campaign.story:
Hi! My name's Jesse.  Some of you may know me from some inspirational videos around the world I made a few years ago, but many of you also know me as a climber you've likely seen at the crags.  This Kickstarter campaign isn't about myself though - it was a community effort that helped me put together a great guidebook in a short amount of time, and hopefully, it will remain a community effort.
I've been very open about the project, and with the help of several people in the climbing community - and local hard climbers Greg Williamson, Leslie Timms, and Mark Smith - I've been able to put together a guidebook for the best crags in Southern Ontario.
Leslie Timms killing it!
A Brief History
Here's a familiar story.  For most of us, the current climbing guidebook looks like this - a mish mash of old guidebooks, PDF printouts, and maybe a document a friend or two put together:
Old guidebooks
I heard about another guidebook being released about 8 years ago, so I waited and waited... and waited.  Same with everyone else.  Eventually, many lost hope, but I did build the app anticipating a possible release.  After arriving at The Swamp for the seventh year, people were still asking which routes were which - it was all kept a secret.
After Greg Williamson released his amazing Lion's Head PDF recently, most of us assumed that a guidebook was never going to happen. And it was really unfortunate because I was meeting climbers around the world who wanted to climb in Ontario, but couldn't find the right information.
The information was all there - the key was to simply put it all together and show climbers we were timely.  So I volunteered over the past half year or so and pretty much gave up much of last summer's climbing season taking photographs and putting together a comprehensive climbing app and guidebook for the most popular climbing areas in southern Ontario - The Swamp, Devil's Glen, Metcalfe, Mount Nemo, Old Baldy, Lion's Head, White Bluff, and TV Tower.  It's been an exhausting effort, but I'll admit it's been fun at times too - who can complain about hanging out at Lion's Head in the fall? 
First, I'd like to thank a HUGE group of old and new school climbers who climbed all the routes and helped me fill in so many details.  Everyone was really helpful and open with assisting me with the project - I can't stress enough how much of a group effort it was.  
Next, I'd like to thank these climbers for their contributions on the hard routes that I may never be able to climb: Greg Williamson, Mark Smith, and Leslie Timms.  I'd also like to thank Joe Stubbs for providing his Mount Nemo photos.  This is all super important because the book was a community effort.  My roles was to piece the information together.
Old Baldy, Mount Nemo, Lion's Head
So here's my current progress.  The app, done in partnership with Rakkup, is 95% complete and pretty much ready to release.  It's really useful, and good for Apple or Android, but I'll tell you about it further down.  Right now, I'd like your support on Kickstarter so I can publish the print guide version.  If you want to see the below previews come to life, all you have to do is pre-order a copy and get your friends to also!   
Print Guide Features
The print guide will be photo intensive, having pictures of most routes.  The photos have been meticulously touched up, so you won't see dark walls against bright skies.
Before and after touchups
I've also made the guide very friendly to those new to climbing, and have included specific approach photos, GPS coordinates, and directions.  At Lion's Head, I have photos of most of the rappel areas.  Every route includes consensus grades, quality ratings, and fun descriptions.
Finally, I put some of my graphic design and photography skills to the test, and whipped up some fun area drawings and climbing photos.  As the book focuses on the best southern Ontario crags, and especially sport climbs, I'll do my best to keep the guidebook lean and mean.
The Swamp preview
Why I'm On Kickstarter
The Canadian dollar is really weak right now, so publishing costs have gone up, and I definitely could use support from the Ontario climbing community, both financially and spiritually - I want everyone to be on board helping and treat this as a community project.
I didn't set the Kickstarter amount too high, but that's kind of a threshold amount, with a bit coming out of my own pocket.  I'd really like this project to come to life and not go into any debt!
Rakkup Sample
App
The app was built in partnership with Rakkup, a digital publisher of rock climbing guidebooks.  It's available on Apple and Android, and has these pretty cool features:
The app doesn't use data.  Everything, including photos and maps, is stored offline once you purchase a digital guidebook
Multiple route photos, which is useful if you're the type who has trouble identifying routes (don't worry, it's common)
GPS.  Never get lost finding a crag again! (or a rappel area at Lion's Head)
1 year of updates.  Get the latest scoop on what's new on the walls all the way to 2017.  Updated instantly once we find out or send something.
The Swamp, Devil's Glen, Metcalfe
Most of all, the speed at which we were able to complete this task shows that my contributors and I are very knowledgeable of all the climbing areas, with local experts mantaining each crag.  More importantly, we can be trusted to be transparent, open (NO SECRETS), and keep you posted and up to date on the Ontario climbing scene.  Another goal is also to have  community contributed updates so we don't have to wait another 20 years for a guidebook!
So that's my story. Many thanks to the climbing community, but we're not over the top yet, so please make a pledge and pre-order a copy!
Extra Rewards For Backers Who Really Want To Help!
Here are some extra rewards on offer if you're a SUPER backer!
Crimp mugs made with holds provided by Ontoro Climbing:
Dry Pointe climbing shoe inserts stuffed into the crimp mugs - keep the funk out!  Also, special shout out to the maker, Margarita - she's an amazing person.
Get some inspirational travel photography prints I've taken (click here for the full choice):
Get a large 30x40 custom rock-climbing painting from me.  Click here for a sample of my work.
Contributor Bio's:
Leslie Timms (in her own words)
I was so immediately taken by rock climbing that I quit my dream job as a canoe expedition guide and was road trip bound with my college sweetheart. After years of living out of the back of a Subaru Outback and climbing rocks across North America, we both eventually got the itch to have a place to call home. Raised in Kingston, Ontario, I've always had a bond with the great lakes and the Niagara Escarpment. On a short climbing trip to the Bruce Peninsula, I fell in love with Lion's Head, the crags of the Beaver Valley, and the small towns scattered along the shores of Georgian Bay. Chasing a dream, my husband and I rather spontaneously picked Thornbury, Ontario to settle in. The location is perfect and the local community was so welcoming that it immediately felt like home. I guided caving, rock climbing and paddling with Free Spirit Tours for years and fell in love with guiding rock climbing. I went on to get certified as a guide and mentor with Professional Climbing Guides Institute and I started up a climbing guiding service called On the Rocks Climbing Guides. I now live out my dreams of guiding awesome people across North America and teaching a variety of custom technical climbing courses at crags close to home. I've loved getting to know the local crags, the people and empowering climbers to get out there and explore too. When I'm not guiding full time, I love developing new routes in Southern Ontario and pushing myself on the trad, sport and mixed styles that the local stone offers. In search of an endless summer, my husband and I hit the road each winter with our 13ft Trillium trailer, to climb, roam and explore until winter passes back home. I think I spend more time dangling from a cliff then I do on the ground and I really like it that way.
Greg Williamson
THE Lion's Head local. Greg Williamson is Bruce Peninsula born and raised, and currently lives with his wife and 3 daughters in Lion's Head, Ontario. He has been one of the leading route developers in the area for years and is a familiar face out at the cliff on any day of the week. You can be sure that Greg is the first and last one on the cliff each year, running solo laps on the classics, eyeing out new hard routes, or belaying his mutant climbing daughters. Greg truly knows the limestone of Lions Head better than anyone and compiled a free regularly updated guide book to the area, in his spare time from being a full time architect.
Mark Smith
Mark Smith has been climbing in southern Ontario for over 17 years. His excitement, energy and positive attitude towards the sport of climbing are undeniable and contagious. He is always looking for ways to contribute and grow the climbing community and now offers climbing clinics, private lessons and more. If you’re interested in improving your climbing while keeping it fun or just looking to have a great time climbing, send him an email and he’ll gladly find a way to make it happen.
Also, special thanks to Neel and Will!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risk is fairly low for the app. It will take about 2 weeks to finalize.

The book is also low risk - if I get enough funding, I will publish it. However, it will require a little more time - but it'll be worth it. The climbing data and route lines are in a database, which after writing some simple programming scripts, converts very nicely into book format, but I estimate I'll need another month to go through the drafts, put in all the graphics from the advertisers, and have mistakes checked out. I will keep everyone posted along the way - after all, that's the fun part of being a backer!

From there, it will take a minimum of 2 months for the book to be queued and published.

The app isn't being sold as a standalone yet, because the earnings has to be split with Rakkup, and thus won't fully contribute to the print guide campaign. If you just want the app, arrange with me directly. 

This winter's been warm, so if you think you'll get an early start, please support me by purchasing the book + app reward. The app has been discounted if you buy both.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hey there, my name is Erik Gordon and I'm the founder of Carabiner Coffee Company. I simply want to say THANK YOU so much for visiting this Kickstarter and supporting this new adventure for Carabiner Coffee Co! Here's the story of what this campaign is all about.
Click the photo to read the story of Carabiner Coffee Co.
I started Carabiner Coffee with the mission of sharing an incredible cup of coffee along with the inspiration to do what you love. For over two years now I've have taken Ol Blue to countless places across the country meeting friendly faces in the outdoor community, sharing stories and most importantly sharing inspiration and encouragement over a great cup of coffee. The love and support that has come from those who have walked up to the door of the van has been overwhelming and never ceases to put a huge smile on my face. I can't imagine doing anything else with my life other than this and that's why I couldn't be more stoked for this next chapter. After two years of constant moving and settling in different areas around the west, it's time to find Carabiner Coffee a home and start spreading the love in a whole new way. 
This Kickstarter campaign is to raise enough funds to open the first ever Carabiner Coffee storefront and coffee shop in Boulder, CO. Not only will this new location be the hub for Carabiner Coffee, it will also be supporting young grassroots companies that are striving to make their mark in the outdoor industry. The new space will be aptly named the Carabiner Collective! 
Take a tour of Ol Blue
The Plan is to keep it just as simple as it is in the van. We will offer small batch drip coffee, pourover and aero-press as the three main brew methods and not a latte in sight. Carabiner Coffee has always been focused on keeping things simple, honest and genuine and that is what I want the experience of visiting the Carabiner Collective to be. Our roast master has been roasting for over 30 years and our beans are responsibly and sustainably sourced strictly from small farms around the world. To me, that is what a great cup of coffee is made of and always will be. 
The Funding from this Kickstarter will go towards many things to get this new venture off the ground. Here are the main objectives that will be accomplished when we reach our goal of $12,000!
+ Finding, renting and furnishing this new space with local, upcycled, recycled, hand crafted and community sourced materials. (it's going to be really really really good looking)
+ Expanding production and supply capabilities of Carabiner Coffee to reach and encourage more people to pursue their dreams. (This means having a desk for the first time ever in Carabiner history) 
+ Collaborating with both local and national grass-roots companies who strive to promote a life of passion, adventure and connection to nature.
+ Providing a place for climbers, bikers, hikers, skiiers, riders, runners and simply just genuinely awesome people (and by genuinely awesome people, I mean all of you) to cultivate and share ideas, laugh and smile because life is beautiful thing and we're all in it together so we should all probably hang out.
What else will the Carabiner Collective offer?
Another goal besides serving you a great cup coffee will be to create a launching pad for small outdoor companies from across the country to showcase their products and put them in front of the outdoor community! There are many local Colorado companies that will be represented as well as others from coast to coast that are fueled by the mission to improve the way we play outside. I can't wait to give these companies a place to show the world the amazing things they are creating and the love that the outdoor community has for them.
Along with supporting small business, the Carabiner Collective will be a space to hold events, outdoor initiatives and simply a place to share the love of being outside! There won't be a day that goes by in this place that we aren't stoked to be there.
Does this mean Ol Blue and Carabiner Coffee are going to stop bringing you great coffee and good vibes across the country?
NO WAY! The Carabiner Collective will only improve the capabilities of coffee tours and give Ol Blue a place to rest her wheels whenever we aren't on the road. Meeting you all out in the wild places is what this company was built on and that will never go away.
PLEASE if you have any questions about this new venture or even new ideas of what you would like to see it become, I'd love to talk with you about it!
You can stay posted here regarding new information and developments as well as on the Carabiner Coffee website www.carabinercoffee.com 
You can also follow Carabiner Coffee on Instagram and Twitter
Thank you from the bottom to the top of my heart for supporting this campaign and the truly awesome outdoor community that it is meant to inspire.
All Love,
Erik Gordon - Founder of Carabiner Coffee Company
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main obstacle in establishing the Carabiner Collective will be finding the perfect location for the space. We will be looking for a centrally located space with easy access bike routes, trails and foot traffic. The faster you can bike, run, ride or slide here there better. Since we will be keeping it simple in the coffee arena, we will not have to go through as many hurdles of health codes and licensing which are always the worst enemy of every new shop. Over the past few years of starting and running Carabiner Coffee out of Ol Blue I've learned how to keep the mission simple and the experience amazing. I can't wait to see this new adventure come to life for the outdoor community both in Boulder, CO and across the country.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Everyone!
i hope you're all having an awesome day! I just wanted to let you know that all the merch for the rewards are finished being hand made by some amazing people and are currently being shipped to Boulder where I'll be shipping them all out to you! That means the MUGS, CHALK BAGS and SNAP BACKS will hopefully be on their way to you by next week. I super appreciate your patients on these rewards and all the continued support on starting this shop in Boulder!! I'm super excited by all the people I've met here in CO and have been making great connections to get a killer space to start working with. As I get ready to head out on tour in the van from mid March - early May in collaboration with Patagonia I will be working with realtors and investors to create the layout for the Carabiner Collective (interior design plans, menu, equipment, ect). I've been getting great feedback from the Boulder community on opening this shop and can't wait to get involved with all the outdoor start ups here in the front range to give a greater voice to the adventure community and support the passion that comes with it.

campaign.story:
Last year we launched our first Havok Kickstarter when my friends and I were looking for a quality watch that wouldn’t break the bank. But most brands we found that actually created a decent watch had an exorbitant price tag. Even on Kickstarter.
After completing the most backed watch project ever on Kickstarter with 4435 backers, we are introducing a passion project in the Havok Racer Chronograph watch using your feedback and suggestions.
The inspiration for the Havok Racer came from vintage timepieces worn by race car drivers in the 1960's. Prior to that, drivers wore stopwatches strapped to their wrist to track lap times. 
We wanted to create a classic racing chronograph watch that captures the scent of exhaust and the sound of roaring engines. The Havok Racer embodies the soul and adrenaline rush of conquering impossible speeds.
With timeless design, quality components and detailed craftsmanship, we have created the perfect racing timepiece whether you're in the stands or the driver's seat.
Several problems needed to be addressed as we designed a watch we could not find: 
AFFORDABILITY: Under $200 on Kickstarter. Working direct to consumer, we pass the savings to you with radical transparency for a quality watch. 
PRACTICALITY: We wanted a precision handmade watch useful enough for everyday wear. Functional & sensible in all situations. 
DESIGN: Beautifully crafted for timelessness in a vintage design. No funky shapes or colors, just a classic timepiece.
Diamond Black Racer
Rose Gold Racer
Our goal? Simply, to create a watch that was practical, beautiful, and affordable.
We decided to design, create, and share a watch that solved all the problems we faced. We wanted to do so, direct to consumer, without any retail markups. At $139, we beat out all competition while over-delivering on the components offered by anyone else- sapphire crystal, solid 316L steel case, debossed steel bezel, japanese movt, and more.
Sapphire Crystal
Our designers and engineers have worked tirelessly to perfect this chronograph watch. Created with premium materials in a symphony of design, a masterpiece was born.
We are generally minimalist in our goods. But in the Havok Racer, we wanted to revive an era where quality was a standard and excellence was strived for.
Every single minute detail of this timepiece was considered, from the semibold font on the tachymetric scale bezel to the legible red tips on the secondary seconds recorder. It is truly an expression of purpose and precision.
Imperceptibly calibrated.
An additional 3 sub-dials offer tracking for seconds, minutes, and hours for ultimate precision.
 An object of design.
The Racer features a tachymetric bezel that allows for speed/distance readings on the go.
An expression of purpose.
For convenient daily use, a 31-date function is integrated into the watch at the 6 o’clock position. The highly demanded sapphire crystal, from last project, comes standard with all watches now.
In designing, we wanted to keep the watch functional and easy to read. A 3-hand analog face with lume offers easy visibility at all times.
To increase durability while maintaining a solid construction, we decided on a 316L steel case. The case was to be sandblasted first, to have all the edges softened, but also brushed, to offer a distinct, durable surface. It is 42 mm for a full-sized chronograph watch.
316L Steel will be used for the cases for a strong, weighty construction. The bezel and backplate are also steel and fitted perfectly. 
BLUE RACER STRETCH GOAL
ROSE GOLD STRETCH GOAL
4 Styles Available
We have 4 different models in this line of Havok Racer Chronograph:
Sapphire Blue: An iridescent blue color-way for a brighter look. Similar to the British Racing Green, but with a contrasting sapphire blue.
British Racing Green: The rebirth of an iconic color-way in the racing world. A classic green face with a natural leather band for a vintage look. 
Diamond Black: The minimal black on black watch for a more subtle touch in your daily wear. Perfect for any gentleman’s wardrobe. 
Rose Gold: An elaborate coupling of rose gold and black for an upscale luxury look. For a little more flare in your every day wear. 
The Racer Collection
Wall Of Cases
We now has an established relationship with our manufacturing partners from the last collection and moving forward will be smooth sailing. We chose to work with this reputable watch manufacturing group known for decades of rigorous quality control. 
We've thoroughly toured their facility multiple times and they are completely aligned with our goals. We visited their facility in the Summer of 2014 in detailed tours and again in January 2015. We will be in constant communication throughout the entire process.
With multiple stages in the manufacture and quality check process, we are confident in their ability to deliver a quality product. We were impressed with their sophisticated manufacture process including different rooms for assembly, air pressure checkpoints, water pressure stations, 48-hour time-keeping accuracy test, and (of course) a drop test. Their facilities meet all necessary regulation and code for operation.
Though they host the manufacturing of many large retail brands, the general managers made sure all of our requirements were met and accommodated. Their experienced staff and attention to detail was what made our decision to choose them so easy. We, at Elliot Havok, are extremely confident they will meet our needs.
MOVEMENT
We wanted to use some of the best input materials on the market for this watch. Inside of the Havok watches are Miyota JS-15 Movements. Miyota has been building reputable, reliable movements for brands like Citizen for decades. Their movements are very accurate and built to last for many years.
The Miyota JS-15 fits our needs perfectly and ensured a quality timepiece. Furthermore, their movements are made with mercury-free batteries and in RoHS compliant facilities.
A common misconception is that automatics are absolute superiors in timekeeping capability. A quartz will keep time just as well, if not better. Battery changing only takes about 5 minutes of your time every several years. But having to re-adjust your automatic watch almost every time you set it down can be tedious. Of course, it's just a matter of price and preference.
SPECIFICATIONS: 
Case Diameter: 42 mm Case 
Thickness: 11 mm 
Face Diameter: 37 mm 
Band Material: Genuine Italian Leather Band 
Band Max/Min Length: 21.5 cm/17 cm 
Band Width: 22 mm 
Total Weight: 69.5 g 
Case Material: 316L 
Steel Back Plating: Stainless Steel 
Clasp: Standard Buckle Clasp 
Clasp Material: Stainless Steel 
Dial Window Material: Sapphire Crystal Glass 
Display: Chronograph Analog 
Movement: Japanese Miyota (Citizen) JS-15 Quartz 
Date Function: Yes 
Seconds Function: Yes 
Water Resistant: 5 ATM / 50 Meters
Battery: Sony SR621SW
Last year, we launched the most backed watch on Kickstarter. We were only able to do so by offering the best product for the best price. Basically “the best bang for your buck”. We will never overcharge and dump ridiculous retail markups onto our supporters. We adamantly dislike when high designer markups are just passed onto the consumer. 
Just because it was designed does not mean it deserves a premium or exorbitant price tag. We wanted to make a watch without having the audacity to charge $200-$300 for a quality watch. In reality, design is meant to be shared with all to benefit. Especially in this Kickstarter community where everyone contributes with ideas and feedback, aren't we all designers? In reality, you Kickstarters help create these products. 
Furthermore, we will offer the Havok watch at wholesale pricing with radical transparency, inspired by Everlane. Not only should the watch be priced so that nobody breaks their bank, but what goes into the watch should be disclosed.
You should know exactly what components are put in the watch and the costs of those components. 
HAVOK TIMEPIECES ARE BACKED WITH A WARRANTY 
We believe in our watches. And you should too. If anything were to happen to your watch within the first 2 years, we hope that you will send it back to us for repair or replacement. We highly recommend you take the watch to a specialist when replacing parts as it requires special tooling. We will cover all internal parts should they ever fail you. 
After the Kickstarter campaign concludes, we will send out surveys gathering backer information to begin production. Meanwhile, we want to continue R&D for the watch. We will rigorously source, test, and research the materials and production of the watch. While the watches are being manufactured and packaged, we will be preparing for large scale shipment to our backers.
This is where Kickstarter comes in. We need your support to launch this line of watches. We are raising funding specifically for R&D, manufacturing, packaging, and logistics for the Havok Racer collection. Your support for the production of these affordable watches will also make them available to all in the future. And of course, you will be the first to own a Havok Racer Chrono. Thank you for taking the time to check out the project.
ABOUT US
Elliot Havok consists of a diverse team of creative product designers with cross-functional skills within the fields of design, development, and manufacturing. Our team encompasses over 20 years of combined experience in bringing innovative products to life. Steven will be spearheading the design and development of the Havok Racer collection, while Bryan and Joseph supervise logistics and backer relations. With the support of the rest of our experienced team including industrial and graphic designers, we are ready to build you a product that you can proudly support. 
Hi-Res Gallery : Here 
For further information, media, and a gallery, refer to: www.elliothavok.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If this project gets funded, we will have to make sure everything goes according to plan to meet the promised deadlines. Projects often have trouble when facing the production process and deadlines for shipment. The project could face possible challenges if the quality of the product or packaging does not meet our requirements after production. We would have to have another production run if this is the case. However, we have extensive experience and close relations in manufacturing and production. We will be producing these high-cost watches in small batches to control quality. In addition, we will not be outsourcing the post-production work to another company. Our team is prepared to ensure that post-funding will run like clockwork when the time comes. (pun-intended) Although we do not see any direct risks and challenges, there are always indirect or unseen tasks that may present itself during the process of production. We hope to run everything as streamlined as possible and ahead of schedule.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
They're soft, they're silky, they're amazing, and they're here! We're proud to claim the title for World's Most Comfortable Tee:
They're built using our signature Modal fabric blend, a sustainable beech-wood derived rayon made of microfibers. It's twice as soft and breathable as cotton, making it the perfect fabric for body-hugging apparel.
Whether for a night out, as an undershirt, working out or lounging, their versatility shines thanks to the blissful 92% Modal and 8% Elastane blend.
With a 190gsm fabric weight, they're light, robust, and higher quality than any other shirt in your closet or department store. They're also half of price!
Colors and Styles
We're introducing the Bliss Modal Shirts in Tee form in three colors: Monaco Blue, Jet Black, and Bright White in both Crew and V-Neck variations in sizes S, M, L, XL, & 2XL. Model wears Medium.
Normal fit on the snug side. Choose between a soft snug fit under your regular size, or a looser fit with a larger size. Model wears Medium.
How do I get them?
It's easy. You have 2 options: 
Option 1 - Underwear + Tees: Add $20 to your underwear pledge for each shirt that you want (no extra shipping).
Option 2 - Tees Only: Choose any of the new pledge level with tees.
These bad boys go from $34 to $60 at department stores, but you'll have the chance to get them for a special introductory price of $20 on Kickstarter. You can add as many as you want! There are no extra shipping charges involved when combined with your pledge for underwear. You can choose your color, size, and style when we send out your Backerkit order form. This will have your credit automatically reflected and you'll have the chance to pick your variations then. If your size doesn't fit as expected, we'll honor all size exchange requests, no questions asked, free of charge. We're already manufacturing them, which means they'll ship alongside your underwear in the same package this March.
Introducing the ultimate interpretation of the word comfort: the Bliss collection by The Comfortable Boxers Co.
Our new collection improves upon our previous boxer briefs through tons of new features and under-the-hood improvements, including an even softer modal fabric, a tagless design, a modal covered waistband, and a brand new fly.
The best part? With the Bliss collection, you'll be looking your best.
We've combined the finest in business technology, design styles, textiles, and machinery to bring you the best underwear experience of your life.
Since modal fabric adapts to your body type, there will never be any tightness or discomfort. Carefully designed with the masculine body in mind, our underwear are custom made just for you.
We've prepared two comfortable styles for our Bliss collection. Our boxer briefs run longer down the leg whereas the trunks run short. Choose your own underwear style or get some of each for the best of both worlds.
We also have brand new colors available for the Bliss collection! We've improved our standard Gray and Monaco Blue, and we've added Bright White, Malibu Blue, and Royal Purple options.
All colors are now unlocked! You'll have the chance to select your color after the campaign ends. You can also mix and match between boxer briefs, trunks, and all available colors!
"Underwear" and "innovation" are two words rarely used in the same sentence, but we can honestly say that we're proud to be leaders of true underwear innovation. Here are a few of the improvements we've made to our underwear:
We've re-invented the pouch by removing the maze that is the vertical fly. Instead, we've turned it on its side. Two overlapping flaps that make it easy to use in any scenario.
At last, you can have both easy access and a sleek appearance.
The waistband features a silky-smooth modal fabric wrap, absolutely no tags, and no distracting design elements or branding.
Waistband elasticity is precisely fabricated and measured for a soft feel and snugness to keep your boxers in place. We then wrap the waistband in modal fabric for the ultimate underwear experience.
This contemporary look not only pleases the eye, but also drastically improves comfort by covering the waistband in the same amazing modal fabric that covers the entire underwear.
And since the waistband is tagless, you won't suffer from that itch that accompanies the ill-placed tag on the back of the waistband. Instead, we've printed the information on the rear inner side of the underwear.
Our underwear is made with 92% modal fabric, an eco-friendly microfiber that enfolds the body in a light embrace. Modal is smooth, soft, and breathable, and its luscious texture feels similar to silk. It’s cool to the touch, super absorbent, and resistant to shrinkage and fading. In short, it’s the perfect microfiber fabric for body-hugging underwear.
We wanted to create the softest pair of underwear in existence. When it comes to underwear, we know that softness is the most important factor, and we’ve found modal to be the softest fabric available. The more modal fabric that’s present, the softer the underwear. So we've improved the fabric by adding 20% more modal than our previous ridiculously comfortable underwear, making softness the key characteristic.
Measurements show that modal is twice as soft as cotton. It's also 50% more water absorbent, doesn't shrink, and doesn't fade.
The softness of modal was measured according to the Kawabata Evaluation Systems for Fabrics in Japan.
We blend 92% modal with 8% elastane for a snug fit that you’ll love. These underwear are designed to contour to your body without any pressure points. They provide both a lush feel and a perfect fit, making them the most comfortable pair of underwear ever.
This unique blend gives our underwear amazing contour properties that allows it to mold seamlessly to your body type. Unlike other underwear, our boxer briefs adapt to your physique for maximum comfort.
Quality underwear requires quality engineering, so we partnered with the finest craftsmen and fabric engineering experts with years of experience refining high-grade materials.
We've paid particularly close attention to the stitching and fabric durability. We've also implemented a new, more robust stitching method that maintains softness. And our new, more durable fabric allows for greater longevity.
We worked closely with the manufacturing facility every step of the way to carry out our vision and transform it into a reality.
When we claim the world's most comfortable underwear title, we better pay close attention to every detail. Stitching is an aspect often overlooked by underwear makers. The underlying problem with traditional stitching is that it falls apart. The logical solution to this is to make a more robust knit. However, this requires more surface area with the use of a wider stitching pattern and stiffer threads. Today's premium underwear companies stop right there. This brings about a new problem: the itch. We weren't satisfied with this, so we worked through multiple prototypes until we reached the level of comfort you'd expect from us. After careful testing, we implemented an idea borrowed from techniques used in premium winter clothing that use 'fluffy' thread instead of traditional hard thread, woven to minimize space between each strand. This is the result:
Not only is the difference visible, but the feeling is completely new and isn't seen in undergarments. It's a complex method that requires careful crafting, and you'll have the chance to feel this with our new Bliss Collection.
In our search for great underwear, we found two categories: Cheaply priced and cheaply made, or premium quality with premium pricing. We didn't like either, so created a third category: quality underwear at an affordable price.
To do so, we cut out all the middlemen and storefronts, excess spending that companies typically suffer from. We go straight to the source and obtain the world’s finest fabrics. We partner with the same suppliers and factories used by big-name underwear companies. Then we turn around and sell them directly to you at far less than the retail price.
We also cut down on excessive marketing and celebrity endorsements. The result: We’re able to offer our underwear to you at less than 50% the price of competing luxury brands!
Kickstarter has provided us with a wonderful platform to connect with backers like yourself. Since we’re manufacturing the product and delivering it directly to you, we can cut out all excess costs and give you the best product and price possible.
Modal’s botanic origin in beechwood trees makes it particularly eco-friendly and sustainable. We only work with ethically responsible suppliers who meet our extensive requirements. Throughout the process, we minimize waste and recover all chemicals used.
This exceptionally ecological fiber is produced using new symbiotic production technology. Using this method, the pulp (raw material) is produced at the same site as the modal fiber itself. This minimizes the energy and resources used during the production process.
Whether you’re out for a run or a game of basketball, our boxer briefs move with you. They absorb water and fit snugly to ensure you’re comfortable even in the roughest conditions.
They also pack light and provide constant comfort for long flights, hikes, and any outdoor activity you can think of. Since our boxer briefs leave no mark on your legs while you wear pants, they’re ideal for wearing to work as well, which means 9 to 5 just got a lot better! You can also take relaxation to the next level by lounging around the house in our silky smooth underwear for a vacation in your living room.
Every fabric we source undergoes rigorous testing by SGS lab testing for fabric weight, color fastness, and shrinkage to ensure quality and durability. Our latest production runs resulted in excellent results.
Everyone has a variety of options to choose from. We're basing our rewards levels on the amount of underwear you'd like to stock up on. This pricing is one-time only but extends to backers on a permanent basis. The more you pledge, the better the deal! However, by pledging now you'll have first dibs on the first manufacturing run. 
Select your pledge level to the right by picking the amount of underwear you'd like to stock up on. After that, select your country and enter the information required by Kickstarter. We'll update you during the campaign with new products and colors as well as information on how to add the items to your pledge.
After the campaign is funded, we'll immediately send over an order form where you'll have the chance to pick your style, color, and size in any combination you want. You'll have over 50 options to choose from! You'll also input your preliminary shipping information so we can coordinate our fulfillment center distribution. We'll then build the underwear and update you on the progress! When they're ready, we'll give you a chance to update your shipping information once again and ship out your underwear.
Our boxer briefs are designed to fit closely but not tightly. If you are between sizes, the larger size will fit better if you prefer a normal fit. If you prefer a tighter fit or have skinnier legs, choose a size lower. To measure, run a tape measure around your waist. Place one finger between your waist and the tape measure for a comfortable fit. You can also use the first number on your jean size as reference. Use this sizing chart as reference:
You'll be able to pick your size, color, and style after the campaign ends.
We promise you'll love them. If your underwear doesn’t fit you the way we’ve described, or if it develops any defects, we’ll exchange them for another size of your choice - on us. Return shipping for exchanges is covered in the U.S. International shipments will carry special considerations depending on each situation. Defective items do not require return shipping. Whichever the case, we'll take care of you!
WASHING INSTRUCTIONS: Natural fibers like modal are known for their ultra soft textures, but washing on too harsh a cycle can cause lint pills to develop long term. If you're worried about long term longevity, separate lights from darks, and wash separately. You can machine wash in warm water, preferably on the delicates cycle, and don’t use bleach or fabric softener (they can't get any softer, believe us). Tumble dry on the lowest heat setting and remove as soon as they’re dry. During our lab tests with SGS, an independent testing service, we got virtually no shrinkage in their most rigorous hot washing test. However, we don't recommend this long-term.
For this second Kickstarter, we've taken more time developing the second collection and are now focusing on quality control and consistency throughout the manufacturing run. This will take some time as our Shanghai quality control office implements the new inspection methods. What you'll get is an amazing and consistently durable product.
SHIPPING: When it comes to shipping your orders, we're changing things up a bit. All international shipments will be fast and trackable.
NEW SHANGHAI OFFICE: Our new quality control office in Shanghai takes care of supervising every manufacturing batch, discarding any possible defective items. 
NEW PLATFORM: Your contribution will also fund the maintenance of our revamped e-commerce platform, which will go live at ComfortableBoxers.com when the campaign is funded. The completely automated order and fulfillment process will help maintain excellent pricing after the campaign with quick and speedy delivery. Any orders from our backers after our stock comes in will ship the same-day!
SUPPORT & HELP: if you have any questions, concerns, ideas, or just want to say hi, don't hesitate to reach out to us at hello@comfortableboxers.com or head over to comfortableboxers.com and chat with us. Whichever way you choose, we answer very quickly!
HELP US SPREAD THE WORD: You can share the campaign directly via the SHARE THIS PROJECT button below the video. 
FOLLOW US: Don't forget to follow us on Instagram, Twitter, like us on Facebook, and read our Blog.
PRESS-KIT: Head over to our Press-Kit for images and information to use for press.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first rodeo! We shipped over 10,000 items to 2,500 backers in 2 days. We then shipped another 5,000 through our e-commerce platform. We have shipping, handling, exchanges, and returns handled beautifully. Our specialized fulfillment center in New Jersey is fully operational and makes sure everything runs smoothly. We've discarded shipping providers that proved to be too slow and upgraded our shipments to a fully trackable service. 

We've lived through many full production runs of high-quality garments and worked with all of our vendors previously. We know the pitfalls, and we know the snags to watch out for. But most importantly, we know more about how to control for quality. High-volume production could pose any number of challenges, but we've partnered with a professionally established manufacturing facility and expanded our quality control through our new Shanghai office. Our staff takes care of supervising every manufacturing batch, discarding any possible defective items.We're putting in more hours dedicated to supervising manufacturing!

We've gone through numerous textile and product prototypes that have gone through extensive testing, including wash and color fastness, fabric weight testing, comfort trials with objective lab measurements, and in-depth lab testing by SGS. We partnered with the right people, completed all sampling, and sourced the best fabrics, so we're confident to ship underwear that will exceed all your expectations. We believe in transparency and blazing fast communication, so our backers will be the first to know about any unplanned hurdles or delays, although, at this point in the project, they are highly unlikely.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Thank you for joining us in bringing sustainably built luxury apparel to the world! We hit our goal in just 1 hour. Now we're off to set some records! You can check out our progress HERE.
Questions about the brand or products? Email us at hello@bensly.com or head to our new website over at bensly.com for more info. If you want to take advantage of early-bird pricing, back us on Kickstarter. To learn more about our practices, click any of the images below:

Well, you're the first to see it, our newest collections have arrived to Kickstarter in full force. CLICK HERE to see them!
THE NEW BOXER BRIEFS
Introducing the only responsibly-made boxer briefs that are softer than silk and completely adjustment-free. Get them here.

comments.content: For the next round, please make a wider neckband.

Hello! I received my order a long time ago and while checking to see if anything new was happening I realised I never left a comment to tell you how awesome your products are and how even better the service is! (I got the size wrong in my first order and even though I am an oversea customer, the exchange process was a breeze and it's truly appreciated!) So thanks again and keep up the good work!

Ok, after using my boxers and tshirts for some time now, I can definitely say they are awesome! When you announced the horizontal fly I was pretty indifferent about it, to be honest, I did not see the appeal, but after using it I must admit to the genius! The material is really comfortable, the quality is high. Pretty early on I punched through one boxer with my finger while putting it on, but what the heck, small flaws can always happen in rare cases and functionality is not compromised. The only sad thing is that I do not have enough to completely use them every day, so they are still reserved for special occasions ;) But that brings me to my immediate point, I would like to get more, but I still also need great socks, back in April you said you were working on something, any news about that? I would hold back my order to have one giant shipment ;)
It's like resting your giggleberries in a soft, magical field of lilies. I just bought some more!
Thanks

If I'm being extremely picky I have noticed a bit of rollover on a couple of the waistbands (the material inside the fabric seems to get twisted) but it's not a big deal. campaign.story:
About The Project
The Problem
Living in Airports is a lifestyle experienced by many business people constantly on the go. Airport line-ups, lost luggage, baggage fees are things we all look to avoid.  Most of the standard trolley carry-ons are not small enough to bypass the bag check, forcing many to wait in lines and forfeit their bags over to the mercy of Airlines.  The trolley carry-ons that are small enough to bypass bag check force us to fold our clothes into tiny compact squares leaving expensive business suits, shirts, and dresses ridden with wrinkles.  
The Design Solution
A carry-on that takes on the look of a classic weekender bag, but fully unzips into a full-on garment bag that allows you to hang your clothes and keep them wrinkle free.  Fill the middle with shoes, tablet, toiletries etc., zip up and go.
When zipped up, the curved shaped of the carry-on ensures there are never hard creases in clothing. 
Specifically measured to meet the carry-on measurement requirements of ALL airlines and comfortably fit under your airline chair for when the overhead storage becomes too full.
 Choose from 2 colors to suit your style:
Amber Brown with Antique Brass Hardware; or
Onyx Black with Chrome Hardware
 Great for a couple day business trip or a week long vacation down south
PLAY

Made using a water-resistant leatherette and stitched together with top quality craftsmanship, this carry-on will hold strong and protect your clothes through all your world travels.
We combine together style and utility for the ultimate carry-on bag. Make sure you follow and like us on Twitter and Facebook for updates throughout our Kickstarter campaign.
Website: www.NoBagCheck.com
Twitter: twitter.com/NoBagCheck
Facebook: Facebook.com/No-Bag-Check
Questions?  Give us a shout at...
Email: TravelBags@NoBagCheck.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After cycling through many prototypes, we were fortunate enough to partner with a fantastic supplier who has years of experience working with fine leathers and leatherette materials. We have just received our first batch order; however, the supply is relatively small and will not last long. 

The great news is that we can start shipping products as soon as we achieve our target goal, which means you do not have to wait months to receive your order. It also means that you can receive orders in time for Christmas - our bags make fantastic gifts! But be sure to place your orders soon, as there is only limited supply to our initial batch order. 

We need all the support we can get on Kickstarter to ensure we can fund a second larger batch order and continue to grow our product lines. We have some amazing designs for future bags and would love to share them with our fellow travel enthusiasts. 

Thank you for all your support!

Justin Dempsey
Founder Of No Bag Check
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
That’s right folks, our last round of Kickstarter Surveys have finally gone out. If you haven’t received one or don’t know where to access your survey, feel free to send us a message or email us at TravelBags@NoBagCheck.com .
For those waiting for February Delivery, they will be shipped out tomorrow, Wednesday, February 24th from our warehouse. Shipping and tracking information will follow within the next day or two.

Hello No Bag Check Backers!
Once again we are overwhelmed by the support we have received by the Kickstarter community, thank you, thank you, thank you!
For those receiving No Bag Check: The Ultimate Travel Carry-On Bag, in February, you can expect them to be delivered during the last two weeks of the month. You will receive an email once your bag(s) have been shipped.

Due to popular demand, we are now offering shipping to the UK! Thank you to all of our supporters in the the UK who have contacted us to express their interest in our exciting new carry-on.  There will be a limited quantity available for UK shipment and with less than 2 weeks left to our campaign, we recommend placing orders at your earliest convenience to ensure that you can receive a bag of your very own.
Thanks again to our UK friends for lending the support we required to expand our supply chain!

As per the suggestion of KickStarter - we have updated our rewards pledge structure to reiterate that all future orders will be shipping as of February 2016.  We are still accepting orders and appreciate all your support guys! Help us keep going!

updates.update_userinfo: We Are Now Offering UK Shipping!
updates.update_content:
Due to popular demand, all future orders of the Onyx Black Bags will be available for February 2016 delivery.
Thank you for the continued support!

Due to popular demand, all future orders of the Amber Brown Bags will be available for February 2016 delivery.
Please note that Onyx Black Bags are still available for December 2015 delivery. 
Thank you for the continued support!

A big thanks to our amazing supporters who have helped us break the $5,000 funding mark in just 2 days! Due to the high popularity of our Amber Brown Bag, we only have a limited supply left in stock available for December 2015 shipping. The great news is that we have more shipments of The Amber Brown bag coming, with shipment available for February 2016. Stay tuned for a second posting notifying when February 2016 shipment will take effect for future orders of the Amber Brown Bags. Thanks again for all the love and support we have been receiving!

I just received my two bags and wanted to leave a review. Out of both the black and tan bags I favor the look of the black bag more, but I think the brown one might grown on me over time. The side zipper handles are small and took some time getting use to. Side zippers are slightly tarnishing, but I doubt anyone can see it without inspecting the bag. I'm 5'10 and 180lbs with a 40R coat shy of 19 in's from shoulder to shoulder. My 40R suit coat fits just at the width limit without forcing it to fit. Length of the bag is fine with an inch or two to spare. Could have used a little more room width and lengthwise as I'm sure larger guys will have a problem. The shoulder strap is missing the two rivets shown in the video and the strap looks a little rushed. Bag smells of chemicals, will need to leave out to air out. With a price just shy of $200 USD and the number of backers that this project had, I think really nice quality leather bag could of been had.

campaign.story:
History is the most important compilation of stories told and the inspiration behind The Americana Project by Brillier. The watches or “chapters” in this collection will not only tell time, but also signify a very important part of American history.
Each chapter will help us write a new story for American Watchmakers told through a collection of timepieces that represent its history. By backing this campaign and the chapters thereafter you’ll help us bring the craftsmanship and culture of watchmaking back to the States where it belongs. Every story must come to an end and ours will do so with a watch that is fully designed, produced and assembled here in the States.
To best tell a story you need to start at the beginning. Meet the “Native Watch” - the inaugural timepiece in the Americana Project. Created to illustrate the colorful and culturally rich Native American people, the watch was inspired by the scenery of our beautiful desert and tribal art of all kinds.
The carefully constructed face of the Native Watch was crafted using thinly sliced pieces of the natural gems of the Southwest. The last year was spent working with different natural stones that best represented the culture to give the watch a truly unique look. The case diameter measures at 43mm and the strap width measures at 22mm.
To really take care of our backers, we designed a "Part II" in the collection to give off a more classic and timeless feel. We stayed true to the beautiful deserts of the Southwest and went for a more vintage mindset when creating the color pallette. By backing at $295 or above you will get both watches in our first chapter and the interchangeable American leather strap.
This is the first step in our master plan of bringing watchmaking back the States. Reaching this goal will allow us to start gathering the plans needed to open a “clean-room” workshop for commercial watch assembly and testing that would employ up to 10 people. At this funding amount we’d be able to train the new employees on all the tools needed for assembly and testing as well as the art of assembly. We would also be able to purchase the necessary equipment to test the watches including water resistance, to open and close case backs and a watch shock tester (to test durability). This facility would give the more than 70 US watch companies a well priced domestic option for assembling and testing their watches. 
Once we have an assembly facility we would be able to implement the making of the case and other smaller components such as hands, markers, buckles, etc. at $225,000 in funding. The money would go towards purchasing milling machinery for true customization, metal plates for the backing of dials and more. At this level we’d only be able to purchase the machine and would need to earn more to actually staff it. Our other option would be partnering with a CNC router company in the States to keep costs low and production more efficient.
Now that we’d have a team and all the necessary equipment to create the foundation of the watches, we would then look at making sure all straps used are American. Regardless of materials, we want to partner with artisan shops around the country to find the best American leather, and other straps made in America. We want to keep things sustainable as well as humane so that any watches produced are truly unique and of the highest quality, reaching and even exceeding the quality of the Swiss companies.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks:
1. Competition from low wage / low price countries.

2. The lack of machinery and tools for watch making, assembling, and testing in the United States. Most of these machines are only available in Switzerland and / or other parts of the world.

3. The lack of already skilled workers in this industry. There are several good US based designers and some good fabricators, but not really in the world of watches.

Rewards:
1. The most important and significant reward of such a grand endeavor would be to bring the lost art of Watchmaking back to the United States where it belongs. This first chapter is only the beginning of this ambitious journey and by the end of it we hope to not only provide jobs for skilled American workers, but to also build a sustainable industry for future generations.

2. Providing a cost effective alternative to other watch companies and brands to provide assembly, testing, and even watch designs and components for their models.

3. Bringing America back to the forefront of watch design and production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers! 
We wanted to take a moment to share our sincerest gratitude for all your support of our campaign. Aside from the 100 backers, we were able to gain an incredible amount of support from International media and the watch industry in general. This showed us that we’re on to something and increasing US assembly, testing, and even production of our products is something you all want. Due to this, we are staying committed to producing this watch for you and assembling and testing it right here in the United States. As a thank you for being one of our first supporters, we will be honoring Kickstarter pricing so you’re sure to get the best deal.

Hey Backers! 
With nearly 10 days left we are working hard to get our project fully funded. We get closer and closer every day and that’s all thanks to you! With that said we’ve met some new Kickstarter friends in the last couple weeks and wanted to tell you about the GoTo Belt.

Hey backers!
The Americana Project has always been more than just another collection of watches. We’ve taken on the lofty goal of bringing watchmaking back to the States on a large scale and today, we are proud and excited to announce that an international luxury watch brand has taken a liking to our efforts. So much so that they are now choosing to do assembly here in the States with us.

updates.update_userinfo: A slight change… For the better!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers!
As you know by now, The Native Watch (Part I) was designed to convey the look and feel of tribal arts and Native American culture. To play an even bigger tribute to the beautiful desert we call home, we changed the orientation of the dial (slightly) by 180 degrees to show off the natural landscape motif that is hidden in the shapes of the dial. We also removed the roman numeral markers to give the dial a cleaner look while staying true to the Native inspirations behind the watch.

campaign.story:
Soul Carrier is a pioneer within the conscious fashion movement that aims to delight people with the opportunity to look stylish while supporting the well being of others. We design impeccable leather handbags for individuals living bold lives of possibility, accomplishment and contribution. 
We're thrilled to have met our goal in just over two days! You guys made it happen - THANK YOU!!! Please stay tuned; the ride is far from over...
The Conscious Intentions Collection
We're debuting our third collection of exceptional handbags via this campaign. The collection is named "Conscious Intentions" and is dedicated to mindful living. Our designs have been influenced by an appreciation of the clean lines of mid-century modern architecture and a fascination with eclectic textiles. The bags are simplistic, functional, and both literally and figuratively capable of standing on their own - they endeavor to express your philanthropic values and spark rich conversations about the human character traits you value most!
Product Details and Fit
The Illumination Clutch celebrates and honors the shining characteristics of individuality and confidence. The design, which features richly textured cowhide fur and varicolored leather, ever so slightly glints in the light. With whip-stitching for added structure and a leather tassel for adornment, the Illumination Clutch symbolizes a raw-meets-refined sensibility.
The Tenacity Messenger bag is a declaration of determination and willpower. Dressed with an optional cross-body strap, this tote adapts to morning routine and business errands. The olive green trim is an ode to the colors that flash throughout the avenues during commute.
The Authenticity Tote is the ultimate embodiment of striking detail and signature style. Richly textured cowhide fur and smooth whiskey leather are tailored specifically for the Authenticity’s personality. This tote shines from the inside out and moves with poise during work or weekend.
The Integrity Tote makes a feature of generosity. It is modestly adorned with our signature “Soul Carrier” charm, and its intricate design offers to carry everyday essentials. By its character, this handbag distinguishes itself as the quintessential Soul Carrier tote.
The Perseverance Case executes a sophisticated silhouette that is equally polished and practical. Built with smooth, sturdy leather following a framework of rolled handles, pockets and zip-closure, the Perseverance pays tribute to the determined modern architect.
 Conscious Intentions Lifestyle Photo Shoot
Just under a week into our campaign we are excited to announce new stretch goals! For each milestone we hit, we'll be rewarding everyone who has pledged to purchase a bag: at $20,000 you'll receive one of our nostalgic Soul Carrier wooden buttons; at $40,000 you'll receive a Soul Carrier coin purse; and at $60,000 we'll include a special Soul Carrier dust bag!
A Soulful Bit of Our History
In response to early backer requests, we're releasing limited quantities of select styles from our Authentic Change Collection during the second half of our campaign. The collection features bold splashes of color on our iconic rectilinear silhouettes. See the photos below for additional details and message us directly via the Kickstarter interface for pricing and availability.
The Authentic Change Collection
Digging Deeper into Our Past...
You asked, so we're delivering! For the final stretch of our campaign we're making limited quantities of select styles from our Journey Collection available, which features a rich fusion of recycled materials forming truly unique, one-of-a-kind pieces. See the photos and video below for additional details and message us directly via the Kickstarter interface for pricing and availability.
The Journey Collection
An Historic Soul Carrier Commercial for The Journey Collection
PLAY

Featured Press
Soul Carrier as a Force for Good
Soul Carrier is a progressive American lifestyle brand that is passionate about designing with purpose. The company launched in 2009 in Phoenix, Arizona under the direction of Founder and Creative Director, Jennifer Paige Boonlorn. Many aspects of art, international travel and life experiences are woven into each unique design collection. The firm's commitment to socially responsible entrepreneurship is currently being displayed via its efforts to become a Certified Benefit Corporation and its pledge to give back to the Greater Phoenix community. Soul Carrier will donate 25% of its Kickstarter fundraising goal to Crisis Nursery, a children's shelter in downtown Phoenix.
About Jenn
Jennifer Paige Boonlorn is the Founder and Creative Director of Soul Carrier. Raised in Phoenix, Arizona, Jennifer graduated from Arizona State University with a degree in business, and moved to New York City to pursue a career in the fashion industry. An unparalleled education at Parsons The New School for Design sponsored her work alongside such powerhouses as Oscar de la Renta, Henri Bendel and American Eagle.
Jennifer’s greatest motivation developed as a result of her contribution to “The Mannequin is our Muse” project for display at the opening of Barneys New York in Scottsdale, Arizona. Jennifer’s visual depth and love for the arts ushered her into a world of distinguished soul-stirring handbags. She's now at work to light the world with conscious fashion!
PLAY

Soulful Swag
iPhone 6 case, coin purse, stickers, and buttons
The Effortless Clutch
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Shipping: Our shipping estimates appear in the details section for each of our rewards. International shipping prices (as well as taxes, tariffs, and duties) vary in different parts of the world. While we believe we’ve accurately forecasted our international fees, we reserve the right to request additional funds from you in exceptional cases. We truly appreciate our international backers and look forward to expanding the Soul Carrier community’s global reach!

Timing: We have carefully chosen our artisan manufacturers based on prior relationships, reliability and experience. We're confident in our team, our suppliers, and our vendors' ability to deliver completed product as promised. There remain uncertainties and risks for delay in any manufacturing process. Although unlikely, procuring our raw materials sometimes takes longer than expected; we are preparing for any potential challenges now by proactively engaging in precautionary steps to prevent delayed deliveries. We will be in frequent communication with you throughout our campaign to keep you abreast of our progress!

Design and Materials: The handbags featured in our video and photos are limited run prototypes. As we continue to refine our designs, slight changes to our finished products may occur. Cowhides have naturally occurring variations in their appearance – we consider this a design asset as it makes each of our bags unique.

campaign.story:
If you have tried using most climbing brushes for your routes and boulder problems, you have probably felt our frustration: brushes are often flimsy and break easily, there are so few bristles that they wear down rapidly, many are re-purposed designs that are too big or too small to be effective for climbing, they don't fit your hand well, and are generally made as a cheap afterthought accessory.
That's why we designed the Sublime Climbing Brush. We've made the perfect climbing brush that respects climbers with its thoughtful design, ease of use, and durability.
Unique neck design is tougher than your latest project and won't bend or snap.
With over 14,000 bristles in our Premium Boar's Hair brush and over 6,500 in our Classic Nylon version, our brush works better and lasts longer. One Year Guaranteed!
Ergonomic handle that fits perfectly in a climber's hands.
Secret Compartment in the handle designed to hold our custom climbOn Bar and also connects to future accessories like our fully articulating stick-brush adapter.
100% Recyclable brush and packaging, because you care about the environment and so do we.
The Sublime Climbing Brush allows you to effortlessly clean holds on your climbing routes or boulder problems, removing friction-killers like dirt and excess chalk, and increasing your ability to hold on. This is even more important for newer climbers whose hands aren't that strong yet and rely more on a hold's natural friction. Quickly cleaning your holds with The Sublime Climbing Brush increases the surface's coefficient of friction, and your ability to hang on and climb the route.
Brushing is a breeze. Each use is quick and light - no more having to use a tiny brush on a giant sloper or push down violently for brushing power. This is achieved by our special ridge reinforced neck design, the unique shape of the brush head, and over 14,000 bristles.
Designed for Climbing. The Sublime Climbing Brush was designed from the ground-up for climbing. Our clever brush-head design allows you to quickly clean the biggest slopers while still being able to clean small features like mono-pockets. Its unique handle fits your hand perfectly so you can clean any hold easily at any angle whether you're on a rope or working boulder problems.
Obsessive attention to quality and durability. We believe in making quality products, and Sublime Climbing Brushes are built to last. We've gone through nine prototypes with feedback from hundreds of fellow climbers to make our brush the best. They feel lightweight, strong, durable, and look gorgeous. We could have easily made them cheaper with a repurposed handle made from bargain materials and fewer bristles, so people would need to replace them more often. This is known in the manufacturing industry as 'planned obsolescence' and is unfortunately pretty standard. But this is something we made for ourselves, as well as our friends in the climbing community and we appreciate quality craftsmanship. Our obsession with making the best and longest lasting brush is probably why it took us about a year and why our bristles are guaranteed to last at least one year.
Looks Gorgeous. The Sublime Climbing brush has a beautiful minimal designed that's a perfect blend of form with function. Our brush's sleek organic lines are complimented with a gorgeous matte finish available in blue, violet, orange, and light grey colors.
More than just a brush. The Sublime Climbing Brush is designed to improve your climbing experience by conveniently carrying your 'need to have' skin-care products, like our custom made climbOn Bar. Our brush's handle can also be adapted to upcoming products like our fully articulating stick brush adapter for your highball boulder problems- no more stick and duct tape!
100% Recyclable. When, or if, you manage to go through your Sublime Climbing Brush, rest assured that it will be recycled and reincarnated into an amazing new product. You care about the environment, and so do we, that's why we made our brushes and packaging to be 100% recyclable.
                        The Sublime Climbing Brush in Classic Nylon
When you need a brush that will work, all the time. Our Classic Nylon brush is designed to last for years. With over 6,500 bristles that last 4 x longer than Boar's Hair, you can rely on this brush to effectively clean your routes and boulder problems for years to come.  
The Sublime Climbing Brush in Premium Boar's Hair
Our Premium Boar's Hair Brush is as good as it gets. This brush will clean every climbing hold amazingly. With over 14,000 individual bristles, its built for high performance and removing anything that could detract from your ability to climb your route, allowing you to climb your absolute best.  
The Climb Harder E-Book
Imagine talking with Tom as well as other top climbers and coaches and asking them for their best tips on how to climb harder and address problems like 'climber's elbow'. Well we have, and we collected them into an E-Book for you.
Or get our Climb Harder E-Book FOR FREE!
If you’re not in a place to financially contribute to our campaign, we still care about your climbing! Simply share our Kickstarter page with your friends on Facebook or Twitter and we’ll give you the full copy of Climb Harder for free. Just click on one of the share buttons below then enter your email where you’d like to receive the book 
http://bit.ly/1KNVhHF
Custom climbOn Bar
We've partnered with SKINourishment to create our own custom climbOn Bar, pure (synthetic and petrochemical free), powerful skin nourisher that fits in your brush's secret compartment.
Kickstarter Exclusive Camouflage Chalkbag
This awesome camouflage Sublime Climbing Chalkbag will only be available exclusively during this Kickstarter campaign. No more will be created. This bag is 7.5" tall, works well for roped climbing as well as bouldering, perfectly holds your Sublime Climbing Brush, and is built for us by our friends at Organic Climbing. Handmade in the USA.
Men's and Women's Shirts
Day Out Climbing with Tom and Training Plan
You'll get everything in our Pro Kit! Plus catch a flight to the U.K. and we'll set you up with a custom training plan and a day of climbing with climbing legend and Sublime Climbing co-founder Tom Randall.
Shipping
We will be fulfilling orders from our home base in Brooklyn, New York. We offer shipping worldwide. Please note that you may be responsible for local duties, fees and taxes.
Our Story
The history of climbing has lots of climbers who have enjoyed pushing themselves on the rock, but maybe not so many who have enjoyed trying to run a business as well. I suppose it’s the hugely time consuming nature of climbing that ends up being a limiting factor and also that many people did not start climbing as a way of making money. I think the cool thing in our industry is that most of the companies are still run (and often owned) by real climbers - the people that truly understand why someone wants to hand over their hard earned cash for a sport which we can mostly practice for free.
By a chance encounter I met a very psyched American climber in 2014. His name was Ransom Allison and he was so incredibly motivated to try and develop some climbing product ideas that I was immediately hooked. I knew from my background in coaching that if someone has that much enthusiasm, they’re going to go a long way! Ransom actually left a lucrative career-path in aviation technology to pursue his dreams in climbing. With the combination of Ransom’s design and technology experience and my long term industry involvement we formed a small start up project called Sublime Climbing. We started Sublime Climbing to develop great climbing products; products we all want and need, but no one makes. Over the last year, we’ve sat down, skyped, talked, emailed and bashed around various ideas. Whilst we have around eight or nine different products that we are continuing to develop, we honed in on the simple idea of a “brush that doesn't break or wear down, and works perfectly” as our initial project we wanted to create.
I must admit, the first few prototypes were far from perfect. Oh my, they broke, or the bristles were too long, or the wrong material, the finishes were awful, and the necks snapped like most brushes out there now. But they got better, much better. After sending many designs across the Atlantic and testing in the hands of hundreds of our climbing friends and by super-star climbers around the world, they became great. It took nine prototypes and about a year of design work.
THANK YOU! Seriously, Thank you.
Our brush is something that everyone out there can see as a reflection of our passion to do things incredibly well and in line with the morals of the climbing community. Together with the climbing community, we've finally made the Sublime Climbing Brush the best brush out there.
So far we have self funded the design, development and sampling for The Sublime Climbing Brush. Our final prototype has been well tested (a lot!) and our manufacturers are ready to go. Every dollar pledged will go towards manufacturing, quality assurance, packaging and shipping. 
Ransom and I really appreciate all the feedback and encouragement so far and are looking forward to you joining us with support to make our project happen.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Ransom and I's Kickstarter campaign is a pledge of your support for two designers who are independently bringing a product to life that might not otherwise see the light of day. You'll be getting a radically transparent look into the process of how things get designed and manufactured.

We’ve already nailed down our manufacturers for The Sublime Climbing Brush. They are a small manufacturer located in the Qingpu District of Shanghai, China and have been working closely with us since we started our design process. We have a great professional relationship with them. Early prototypes have been produced, however when manufacturing any physical goods there are sure to be unforeseen challenges, both big and small. We promise to be open and transparent in our communications in timing and/or design changes.

Some of the foreseen risks and challenges: 
1) Getting our colors exactly right during mass production
2) Maintaining our strict quality control so that each brush meets our standards
3) Tooling or mass production delays
4) Delays in bulk shipping and unforeseen customs issues.

We feel confident the The Sublime Climbing Brush will be successfully produced, but when manufacturing—especially overseas—some delays should be expected. We have done our best to account for this in our timeline, but we will be updating all of our backers with the latest information until the shipments are made.

The Sublime Climbing Brush is a product we are deeply passionate about and have being working on it relentlessly. Now with your support, we can make it a reality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Our great friends at Startup Rock Climbing, the one's who helped get our project off the drawing board and into your hands, are having a HUGE giveaway.

Status update
Wow are we busy. We managed to get brushes to the ISPO show with our friends at ClimbOn, and some brushes to trade shows in the UK as well as Japan. People are really loving the products, which is a great feeling. We keep hearing great reviews.
We are getting ready for the Outdoor Retailer tradeshow in Utah, headed out tomorrow! Such a huge opportunity and we really couldn't be doing any of this without the support everyone showed. Thank you!

Tom and I have really been blown away by the support for our climbing brush! This has been really amazing to bring to life. We can't believe we finished at 426% FUNDED, not to mention THIS BECAME THE MOST BACKED CLIMBING PROJECT EVER.
Pre-Orders are Now On Our Website
Right now I'm working on a system to handle so many backer's efficiently. Should have survey's out this week or weekend so you can easily itemize your choice of colors, sizes, and any extras you added funds for.

You guys have done it again! 
We're at 400% funded with 24 hours to go.
This continues to be such a great climbing community project. We've had backers support our project and order our brushes from all over the world. Its amazing to see support coming in all the time.
