campaign.story:
Did you miss our kickstarter? Don't worry, Sole-Socks are still available on our website. Click the button below to see our entire offering.
     Sole- socks is a simple solution to a common annoyance / problem. In today's ever evolving fashion and style trends, more and more people are going sockless. It's become a very popular look  for both men and woman. In addition, there are others who just don't like socks, whether it be for convenient or laziness, they don't want to wear socks. There are a couple big problems that everyone who is trying to pull off the sockless look has to deal with. The first is, if you choose to wear socks, you have to find super small thin socks that don't go above the shoe line. These socks are typically tight, uncomfortable and slip off the heel throughout the day. The other option is to fold down larger socks and deal with bunching and unevenness on your foot. The last option is just to choose not to wear socks. This seems like the most logical right? But then you run into the issue of having sweaty, smelly feet  trapped in your shoes and no matter how many times you try to air them out, or even wash them, the smell won't go away. I can't tell you how many pairs of shoes I have had to throw away from rancid, funky smells from not wearing socks.  
 Sole- Sock are specifically designed with those problems in mind. We started with a plush terry cloth top, which absorbs the moisture, odor, and all the other funky things that come from your feet throughout the day. This 100% cotton Terry cloth has been specially designed to be thick with long loops in order to be breatheable enough to let air through to the foot while the fibers are designed in a way to absorb and wick away moisture in your shoe. The terry cloth is attached with a durable cotton outer layer of fabric and attached with a Bosnian embroidered stitch around the entire outer edge of the sole. The zig zag looking stitch insures durability and quality during the length of the product's life. Sole-Socks were designed to take the wear and tear that occurs each day on your feet. The final component of the design is the base, this is designed in such a way to allow the sole to grip the inside of your shoe and prevent slipping. These same fiber that grip and stabilize the Sole-Sock, are designed in such a way to allow air to flow from underneath your foot. This allows your foot to breathe, cools it down and reduces sweat and odor. Additionally, the base layer is perforated to allow the foot to breathe from the bottom. This bottom layer also acts as a padding and support. Sole-Socks are designed in a way to offer a little more cushion and comfort on the bottom of your foot. At the same time we designed it in a way to make sure it wasn't too bulky to cause the shoe too become tight and uncomfortable. These were designed to be treated like a pair of socks. The newest addition to the sole sock original is the Polyester toe cap. Its design with a very minimal seem to insure comfort and not cause an annoying irritation across the top of your foot. We use a durable polyester toe cap to help offer protection and comfort while allowing airflow and maximum breath-ability.  
Both styles of Sole Socks work for many different shoes depending on what you prefer and what your needs are. Depending on the type of shoe and your preference both sole-sock original and sole-sock 2.0 has you covered.
Info
 Step One: Find out what shoe size you wear. The easiest way to do this would be going to your closet and looking at your shoes. Once you know this, order that size of Sole-sock or sole-sock 2.0.  Step Two: Once you receive your sole-sock in the mail simply place the left and right foot beds into your chosen pair of shoes. (Should I remove the existing sole? it all depends on your preference. Most people lay the Sole-sock on top of the existing sole due to the fact these are designed as sock and not sole replacements.) Step Three: Put on your shoes and go about your day. Step Four: At the end of the day simply remove your custom pair of Sole-Socks and throw them in the washing machine if need or use them again the next day.  It's as simple as these 4 steps, treat them like you would a normal pair of socks. 
As you know going sockless is not as easy as it should be. Having to deal with super small baby socks, socks with holes, rolling down socks to get the look but dealing with bunching. You could always go no socks at all but the aftermath is unbearable.  
FACTS:
- The average person owns 22 pairs of socks
- There are 250,000 sweat glands on your feet
- The most sweat glands on the human body are found on the bottom of your foot.
-80% of the sweat on your feet come from the bottom
- 1 cup of sweat is produced from your feet each day.
- Socks don't show anymore   
- Extra padding for soles of your shoes
- Blocks odor - Breathable - Absorbs moisture
- Prevents athletes feet symptoms
- Comfortable
- Very convenient
- Machine washable
- Customization to your size and fit  
- Able to use in almost any type shoe
- Take up less space in suitcases / dresser drawer space
- No more socks with holes
To make this as successful as possible in both feedback and sales, we need your help. Whether it’s purchasing a product, sharing it on social media or just telling a friend about it, your support is much needed and we truly appreciate the love.  
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/solesocks
Instagram: @sole_socks_
Website: www.sole-socks.com
For any distribution, sales, Marketing, Media inquires contact us at info@sole-socks.com
WE HAVE SOLD OVER 30,000 PAIRS OF SOLE SOCKS UNDER ONE YEAR. HEAR ARE SOME OF THE PLACES WE HAVE BEEN FETURED
SIZING: You may be asking how do I know what size Sole-Socks works best for me? We work on a US shoe size system, in both Men's and Woman's. We recommend you purchase the size of sole-sock that you would for shoes size. Sole-Socks are offered in whole sizes only, if you are a half size no worries we got you covered. Sole-Socks are designed to fit full and half size shoe sizes. As a rule of thumb, for those individuals who wear a half size we recommend going down to the nearest whole size. For example if you are a size 9.5 you would order a size 9 Sole-Sock. See chart below for to reference what size will work best for you. below. 
 Mama Dame helping us design our Sole Sock 2.0 before it went to our manufacturer.  
Product testing at its best
Get Your Project Funded Today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the biggest challenges I think we will face is educating people that there are other options available besides socks. Getting customers to understand how the sole socks work and that they actually do work.

Educating customers will be a challenge but the better photos and videos with more details we hope to overcome the lack of a current sockless options currently offered.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As always thanks so much for your continued support. 
As we continue to launch new products we realize that many of you continue to support us with each new product. 
That is partly why we wanted to send a quick update, to let you all know that we have the Doggie Duffel live on our website. This was a project we launched soon after the pillows on kickstarter. If you visit www.rangetravelgoods.com you will now be able to buy it at more than a 15% discount for a short time only. We wanted to give our backers a chance to get one at a discount before we set our retail pricing in a week or so. Also on our website you will find all of our other Range Travel Goods that were launched right here on kickstarter over the last few years.

updates.update_userinfo: We have RESTOCKED in all sizes
updates.update_content:
Hey Guys, 
We have some good news, We just changed manufacturers and updated a few of the features on the Sole socks plus and sole sock basic. We are excited about the improved quality, better fit and durability that the new manufacturing partner has brought to SOLE SOCKS. Specifically, we updated the toe cap on the plus style to fit the toe box better as well. The feedback on the new product has been great.

It has come to our attention that there are a few backers have still not received their Sole-Socks reward. After looking into what happened it appears that there were a few that must have missed our survey that was sent out to everyone after the campaign ended through a website called bakerkit.com, and also sent out a few reminders.  We apologize for any confusion in the survey process. We’ve sent out any of the stragglers today, and hope that that is now behind us. If you believe you are one of the individuals that never took the survey and have not received your sole-socks please let us know.

sorry,
the correct email is info@sole-socks.com

Backers,
We owe some of you an apology. There was a mix up in production and some wrong sizing was put into wrong packaging. It was just with a few sizes but we are getting it handled. If you are one of these people, please contact us through info@sole-sock.com or through the KS messaging platform. We want to work with each of you individually to solve these issues. We are very sorry for this mix up.

We are very happy to announce that, as of this week all the orders have been packaged and delivered to the post office. Once again we are very sorry for the delay that we experienced from the manufacturer and cannot thank each of you enough for your continued patience.
As a thank you for your patience we are extending our kickstrarter pricing on our website for a few more weeks. In addition, each of your packages should have arrived with small card with a promo code for 10% off on it. On the card it states that the code expires in September (sorry, they were printed before we knew of the delays). So we are extending that promo to the end of November. This means you will be receiving an extra 10% off of the already low kickstarter price.

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter campaign is over! It's been an amazing 45 days and we're looking forward to getting production started.
To order some SilverAir Socks & Shirts, head on over to yathletics.com
Why you'll love the SilverAir Sock:
Our Story
Y Athletics was born on Kickstarter with the help and support of thousands of backers from over 70 countries. Our mission is to design and manufacture the highest quality products in each activewear category, using the best materials and technologies on the market. Simply put, we create products that are engineered for performance and insanely comfortable—you’ll never want to take them off.
We leverage cutting edge technologies like seamless knitting, which eliminates the need for stitches and ensures minimal irritation. Our fabrics are sourced from unique locations around the world, wherever innovation is occurring most rapidly. This includes yarns knitted with pure silver, which prevents odor from accumulating on your gear.
A year ago, we launched our first product - the SilverAir Shirt - and our fans helped us raise more than $250,000 to kickstart our dream. We’re frequently asked what’s next and now have an answer: 
After many months and hundreds of hours in development, we got the formula right and our next product is ready. We are proud to introduce the SilverAir Sock - It's beautiful. It's comfortable. It's odorless. It just works.

Development
This is a brand new fabric. We sourced the finest merino wool from Australia, known for its natural performance and odor-resistant qualities. But wool by itself is not soft enough, so we added acrylic for superior comfort, nylon for durability, and spandex for stretch recoverability. Finally, we blended pure silver on the areas that accumulate the most sweat, which takes the odor-fighting capability of this sock to a whole new level, unlike anything you’ve experienced.
After fabrication comes construction and we iterated until it was just right. We used seamless knitting to create a sock without any stitches and added vent panels that allow airflow to keep your feet cool and comfortable. The sock is beautiful inside and out. After you've worn it a few times, you won’t be able to go back to anything else.
Testing
We've been testing our socks rigorously over the last 9 months. A backer from our first campaign cycled 800 miles for two weeks wearing the same pair of SilverAir socks. A decathlon athlete wore them through his entire race and the socks stayed fresh. And, of course, we wear them every day ourselves. Every test led to improvement until we got them just right. 
Production
This is where you come in. We're still a young brand that's self-funded, and to bring these socks to market, we need to manufacture them at a moderate scale. Help us fund our first production batch of the SilverAir Sock and be the first to receive a pair... your support would mean the world to us.

How It Works
Where It's Made
We're proud to work with the best manufacturers in the industry. Here's where our socks and our shirts are made:

SOCKS:
SHIRTS:
Colors & Styles
SOCKS:
Thanks to you, we will now be offering our socks in six colors. Check them out: 
The Jet Black and Electric Blue are exact colors. The other 4 colors were unlocked as stretch goals and the colors shown are mock-ups. We'll show the actual socks in a future update.

SHIRTS:
For this campaign, our shirts will be available in the short sleeve crew and V neck styles in six colors - Carbon Black, Jet Grey, Surf Blue, Alpine White, Alloro Green and Marino Blue.
Measurement Guide
SOCKS: Our socks are unisex and will come in two sizes*:
*Due to a small number of our backers having a shoe size of 14 and above, we are going to be producing an XL size for shoe sizes 14-16. This size will only be available in our most popular color - Jet Black.

SHIRTS: Our shirt sizes are men-only for the time being. The shirts are fitted. We recommend sizing up if you prefer a loose fit.
*Carbon Black color may not available in the XXL size
**Please check our web-store for the latest measurements
Shipping / Delivery Schedule
Kickstarter backers will be receiving their shirts and their socks together. We estimate the following timeline:
MAY 2015 - Campaign closes. Backers' selections finalized.
JUNE 2015 - Raw materials are sourced and shipped to our factory.
JULY 2015 - Production period.
AUGUST 2015 - Finished products are shipped to our distribution center and on to your doorstep.
Where We Are
SOCKS - We've been working with our sock manufacturer for almost a year now. We've made and tested dozens of prototypes and feel confident in bringing them to you. The socks you see in pictures are production-ready and we'll start manufacturing them as soon as we are able to raise the funds for production.

SHIRTS - We have delivered thousands of shirts to the backers from our first Kickstarter campaign and continue to deliver shirts to customers every day. The production of our next batch of shirts will start soon and we want you to be the first to get your hands on them, at a deal exclusive to this Kickstarter campaign.

Help Us Spread The Word
We need your help to get the word out, so please help us by telling your friends and family about us. We also give away prototypes to our fans on facebook and twitter from time to time so keep an eye out...
International Backers
Carrier - We ship to most international countries via FedEx, to ensure the package is delivered to you safely in the shortest amount of time. If you would like to opt-in for another shipping method, please email us at hello@yathletics.com
Duties & Taxes - Please be aware that all international shipments are subject to duties and taxes by your government and you are responsible for paying that. All Kickstarter rewards will be declared 'gift', however, most countries will still assess a value and in certain cases FedEx will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter project and we have done our best to make realistic projections of the amount of raw materials we need, the time we need to receive them, and the time we need to manufacture the socks. However, manufacturing at the standards of Y Athletics has its own complications. Every single detail is scrutinized and we don't settle for anything less than perfection. The risk with that is that it if unavoidable production issues come up, the delivery of your rewards will be delayed.

With that said, we will make two promises:

1. We will deliver the highest quality product to each and every single backer. We take extreme pride in making some of the best products in the world and will never compromise on quality.

2. We will keep the lines of communication open at all times. If we have hurdles, you'll be the first to know about them. We encourage you to take a look at our communication with backers from our first Kickstarter project:

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/yathletics/silverair-odorless-athletic-shirts-made-with-pure/posts
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing The SilverAir Merino Wool T-Shirt
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
Two weeks ago, we launched our newest product and 7th Kickstarter campaign: The SilverAir Merino Wool T-Shirt - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/yathletics/silverair-merino-ultralight-t-shirt-for-travel-and?ref=cv6am0
This is the lightest t-shirt we've ever made, with a double sided fabric that is one of a kind and exclusive to YA. It consists of 17.5 micron merino wool on the inside, combined with our signature SilverAir yarns. Together, they provide fantastic thermoregulation and take anti-odor performance to the next level.

Hey Backers!
I hope you all are having a fantastic day. We have a few exciting updates to share with you. If you have any questions, email us at hello@yathletics.com.
OUR UNCONDITIONAL PROMISE
We get emails and comments every day showing us the adventures you're going on and the fun you are having while wearing your SilverAir socks. That's what we made them for! And for that reason, we built them to last. If your socks wear through (i.e. get a hole) in the first year of wearing them, we'll send you replacements - no questions asked.

Dear Backers,

It's been an amazing journey and we’re so grateful for the opportunity to design products for you. Your support truly means the world to us. As always, there were a few small hiccups, but we hope you were satisfied with our transparency and the final product.

Today, we want to announce something exciting:

Hey everyone!
Here's a quick snapshot of the shipping status:

Hello Everyone!

It's been a little more than 2 weeks since our last update, so we'd like to share what's going on with deliveries. Since many of you already have the socks on your feet by now, we'll also share some information on what to expect as you use them. If you're wearing your SilverAir socks, we’d love to hear your early feedback.

Shipping
We started shipping on Tuesday the 22nd and have continued sending out socks every single day. Packaging and shipping is taking a bit more time that we initially anticipated. Here's a snapshot of our current shipping status:

Hey Everyone,
We plan to start shipping socks within the next week. There has been a small, unexpected hurdle which prevented us from shipping this week, and we just wanted to let you know about it:
We did some test deliveries and the boxes our socks ship in were getting crushed in transit. We immediately designed new packaging using corrugated cardboard which will protect the sock boxes. It's being manufactured this week and we hope to have it in our hands on Tuesday the 22nd and start shipping socks.

Hey guys!
Just wanted to give you a quick update and let you know that we're still on schedule to start shipping your rewards in mid September. September 14th is our target date to start shipping and we hope to complete shipping everything by the end of the month.
If you need to change your address or add/remove shirts and socks from the add-ons, you have until Tuesday (September 8th) to do that by going to https://silverair-socks.backerkit.com. We'll be locking in all orders after Tuesday and will be charging credit cards for those who have added shirts and socks through BackerKit.

Hello Everyone!
Thanks so much for taking the time to complete your surveys. If you haven't gotten a chance to complete it yet, please do so as soon as possible as we cannot ship your rewards if your survey is incomplete. If you haven't received the survey email, please check your spam folder. You can also visit this link to retrieve your survey: https://silverair-socks.backerkit.com

campaign.story:
We've heard your feedback and made some changes:
We've heard your feedback and made some changes to how our SPIES work which changes the Ambassador and Duke tier rewards a bit.  Please read the update here for more details. Check out the info graphic below for the updated rewards!
Coup: Mobile Edition is coming to Physical form!
Physical deluxe edition (Coup + Coup: Reformation) will be available as an add-on item! Please read the details here!
Box art not final.
Help bring the hit game Coup to iPhone and iPads everywhere!
Thanks for checking out our Kickstarter! 
We are Banana & Co, a super small games development studio based in San Francisco, CA made up of three mobile game veterans who recently decided to quit our day jobs and make games that we love playing.
We're really excited to be working with Rikki Tahta and La Mame games to develop a mobile version of the hit card game Coup.
Coup (and its expansion Coup Reformation) by Rikki Tahta was a successfully funded Kickstarter project published by Indie Board & Cards.  
You can check the previous Kickstarters out here and here. 
For those new to Coup, below is a video overview from Tom Vasel:
There are also plenty of written reviews out there.  Here are some of our favorites.
The Mobile Edition
The idea behind the game is to take Coup but be able to play it anywhere, anytime, with anyone.  We've focused on making the game feel like you're playing live (trash talking, reading your opponents, bluffing), but also that you're playing with a much wider network of players. Similar to games like Words With Friends, you don't need to be in the app to play a game - you can take your turns at your convenience.
As huge fans of Coup, we want to deliver a mobile experience that is intuitive, smooth, and (most importantly) fun!
FEATURES:
Bluff, steal, and manipulate your opponents on the go.
All new art and 5 gorgeous new cards.
Play up to 4 player games, worldwide.
Invite your friends or play ranked matches with random opponents.
Increase your rank by earning achievements and badges...and winning.
All new art and cards
In setting out to create a new card deck, we wanted to deliver a unique set of characters. We decided to contact some of our artist friends who we knew could nail the style we were going for. We love what they came up with, and we hope you do too. 
New art!
Here's a look at how some of the characters were developed, from sketches to paint.
The Duke, for once not taking tax.
The Ambassador, from pencil to celebrity, to global diplomat.
We know many folks would prefer the cards from the tabletop version of Coup, so we've got you covered there too.  We're working with Indie Board and Games to include the their cards as well.  You can choose which deck to play with at any time.
Original Coup card art included
In addition, Duke Tier backers will also receive the alternative card set from Indie Board & Cards as well as free alternate decks we release in the future.
Alternate IB&C set free for Duke Tier
Play multiplayer games worldwide
The mobile version of Coup can be played with your friends and players anywhere in the world. 
Play with your friends
You can create private games with your friends anytime, each match supports up to 4 players.  You can add friends to your friend list by inviting them directly, importing from your contacts, using Facebook, Game Center, or by adding favorite players you've met in any of the ranked matches.
Ranked Matches
Think you've got what it takes to take on the best Coup players?  We've created multiple ranked rooms to match you with opponents all over the world.  Wager a small amount of your reputation in rooms with newbies, or risk more and play against the best.
Reputation
As you win ranked matches you earn Reputation.  Higher ranked rooms, where presumably you will face better opponents, will require a higher wager of Reputation to enter.  Of course the upside of this is that you can win much more Reputation as well. 
Friendly matches with your friend list do not require any Reputation to participate in.
Choose carefullly...
SPIES expansion
This SPIES expansion is a one time purchase to unlock for the general public, but is included for all KS backers (Ambassador Tier and above).
SPIES won't reveal confidential information within a game - that would be unfair. It will show you historical stats (most claimed card, bluff %, favorite ways to kill) that gives you a "read" into your opponents play style, similar to as if they were part of your live play group.
With the SPIES expansion, players will get 1 Spy to use per match. It’s up to you to decide how and when to use this limited resource. Do you want to use it to hide your stats right away (and consequently be unable to see anyone else’s), or save it for later in the game?
We’ve been playing around with this for a bit and it adds a nice layer of strategy to the game that we think is really fun.
Achievements and Badges
Complete over 50 achievements to increase your rank and unlock new badges to display on your player profile.  Kickstarter backers can receive a one of a kind badge to use as part of a reward.  More achievements and badges will be added for future updates.
Ranks/Achievements and revealing opponents stats.
Stretch Rewards
7K - Coup: City State Cards - UNLOCKED! Unlocks the original Coup: City State cards from La Mame Games added as an optional card deck for all KS backers.  You will be able to switch decks anytime.
The OG Coup cards
35k Animated Cards - UNLOCKED (see update here):
Gorgeous fully animated versions of all of our new cards.  Take a look at a sample we made below: 
Ok maybe we overdid it with the lightning a bit..
100k - Android - We will hire a team to help port this game to Android devices.  If we hit this stretch reward, the Android version would come out after the iOS launch. Note that even if we don't hit this stretch reward, Android is still something we want to do.  Check out the comments section for more details.
Our Story
This all started when 2 (out of the 3 people that make up Banana & Co.) started playing Coup... a lot.  In the corner of bars and sometimes on the ground.  
Our office in SF, come by and say hi.
After some discussion about how the game could be made into a mobile multiplayer experience, we contacted Rikki Tahta, the designer of Coup.  We've been collaborating with him ever since on designing and developing the game so it works great on the go.
There were of course tons of design and technical issues to solve.  These include how the turns would work, how challenges would work, and in general making sure the flow of the game feels good when your not sitting across from your opponents.
Since we got our prototype up and running some of us have retired our paper copies and have been playing exclusively on our phones.
What will we use the funds for?
We will primarily use the funds for two things.  
One, to set up the backend infrastructure we need to handle tons of people playing multiplayer games.  We have proof of concept and prototypes working, but we need the funds to deploy this on a large scale.  Also as part of the backend system, we want to create a robust system for player stat tracking.  This will be used in conjunction with SPIES to gain insight into players play style.
Two, to pay for the art we need to finish the game and make sure everything is nice and polished for the release.  We really want to animate these cards too, we think that that subtle movement of the card animations will bring the game to life.
We have the technical ability and experience to do most of the work ourselves to create the game. The above two items, however, are external costs that we need help with.
About Banana & Co.
  We are a super small games development studio based in San Francisco, CA made up of three mobile game veterans.  We've all been making mobile games since 2003 at companies like Glu Mobile and Booyah!.  
Together, we've shipped over 50 mobile games.  In early 2013, we decided to quit our day jobs and start Banana & Co. 
Video games have been a huge part of our lives, and we truly love making games. Over the past few years we’ve been getting more and more interested in board and card games, so bringing Coup to mobile is an exciting new venture for us. 
We hope the success of Coup Mobile will lead to more awesome opportunities in the future!
Banana & Co. circa mid 80's
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest risk is delivering the game on time for you by May 2015. 

This means a lot of QA/Beta testing, multiplayer online stability and reliability.

To mitigate this, our team has already completed the design and a large chunk of the development for the game. We need your help to push this game past the finish line with the level of quality that it deserves.

Our team has shipped dozens of mobile products in the past on incredibly tight deadlines and budgets, both original titles and big licensed products.

We're 100% committed to shipping and delivering our game to you no matter what. Thank you for putting your trust in us and we plan to deliver an awesome experience for you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Help us play test The Chameleon, the new game from the designer of Coup.
updates.update_content:
Hello, hope everyone has been well.  It's been a while but we're happy to announce that Coup is finally coming to Android and will be available on Thursday, June 16th.  The Android version is fully compatible with the iOS version.  Look out for the game on Google Play and don't forget to tell your friends!
As always, email us at coup-support@banana-co.com if you have any questions.

Hey guys!  We've recently launched an update to Coup which adds a bunch of new features. We realized that we haven't posted here on our past updates so here's a roundup of everything that's new since launch:
Brazilian card deck added. These are free for all Duke+ backers. 
Daily, weekly, and monthly leaderboards. These rank players by net reputation earned, win rating, and skill.
Historical statistics against opponents. See number of times played, wins, losses against specific opponents.

Hey guys! We've recently launched an update to Coup which adds a bunch of new features.  We realized that we haven't posted here on our past updates so here's a roundup of everything that's new since launch:
Brazilian card deck added.  These are free for all Duke+ backers.
Daily, weekly, and monthly leaderboards.  These rank players by net reputation earned, win rating, and skill.
Historical statistics against opponents.  See number of times played, wins, losses against specific opponents.
Yeah!!

Coup is now LIVE on iTunes!!
https://itunes.apple.com/app/coup/id874995624?ls=1&mt=8
After downloading it, just sign in using the same method you used during our signup. Your rewards will be automatically unlocked in the game. Also, please note that the email and username fields are case-sensitive.

Hello!
Great news to share, we've finalized our launch date which will be this Thursday, April 23rd.  Get ready!  We'll send out another note when the game is live.
We're also starting to ship out backer rewards, so you should be seeing those arrive soon.  There were a few backers that have not filled out surveys yet, we've sent you a private note if your shipping details are still needed.

Our launch date is fast approaching!  The game will tentatively launch the tail end of next week.  We will post another update once we have the date finalized.  Some things to note:
If you have not signed up already for your Coup accounts, please do so before this Friday, April 17th.  The signup page is here.  If you do not choose to signup via Facebook, you will still have the option to link your account to Facebook later in the game itself.
If you requested additional copies of the mobile game, you will be receiving a separate invoice today.  Remember that you can use the signup page multiple times (up to the amount of additional copies you requested in the survey).

campaign.story:
What sets Handground apart from other grinders?
Locking top so bean particles don't fly out while you grind
Side-mounted handle for better ergonomics 
Wide base for more stability while grinding
100g Capacity hopper able to contain enough coffee beans for 5 cups of joe
Coarseness adjustment ring to select a grind setting with one twist
20 preset coarseness levels at 125 micron intervals fit for any method of brewing
38mm conical burrs made from densely sintered Alumina ceramic which has high strength and hardness, temperature stability, and high wear resistance and corrosion resistance
Triple mounted stainless steel axle to eliminate burr wobble and produce a consistent grind 
Borosilicate glass catcher to prevent static and sticky grounds
By choosing one of the reward levels above, you will become one of the first people in the world to own a Handground grinder. Select a reward from the column to the right or click one of the rewards on the image above.
  Handground is the result of thousands of coffee enthusiasts around the world contributing their time and ideas. From home brewers to national barista champions, people from all corners of the world have leant lifetimes of experience with coffee. 
The power of this experience shines through in the design of the Handground coffee grinder. It took hundreds of iterations and incremental improvements to get to the final design and there is no other way it could have been done without the help of these people. Here are just a few pictures of the people behind Team Handground.
By backing this project you will join Team Handground and have the opportunity to participate in decisions going forward as we move into production. 
The idea to make a better coffee grinder started from something we called the "Crowdsourced Coffee Experiment". We were attempting to apply a Japanese principle called Kaizen to our coffee routine. It wasn’t long before we learned how important a good grinder is to making better coffee so we purchased an entry level manual grinder. 
The new burr grinder was a noticeable improvement over the blade grinder, however we couldn't help but notice areas for improvement. Since Kaizen means continuous improvement we started to look for better options. Yet after searching the market and seeing the same ancient designs being repeated over and over we finally thought, we can do better.
Originally we wanted to name the company Kaizen Coffee but decided to do a survey with our top 4 name choices. The surveys came back and we learned a ton of things that we didn't know that we didn't know. For example, Kaizen is impossible to spell and associated with German culture (which isn’t a bad thing) but it is a Japanese term that was being perceived as something other than what we intended.  
Handground, on the other hand, was easy to spell, simple to remember, and had tons of positive connotations. The choice was obvious, but only after consulting the coffee community. We decided to apply the same crowdsourcing principles everywhere we could for the rest of product development. That's when we held a design competition. Hundreds of designs came in and Team Handground helped narrow down the pool to 6 finalists. After the final round of voting, Joaquin Herlein had won with a design that was the beginning of everything you see now.  
Joaquin has continued working with Team Handground to improve on the initial design. Every time a major design decision or tradeoff arrises, members of Team Handground give their opinions and ideas through surveys and open ended responses. This effort has led to a 50% reduction in the number of screws used and an overall height that brings the grinder into alignment with the golden ratio. 
We started our Instagram on day one as a way for us to document our journey but it has turned into so much more. I don't think we want to try to count how many hours we've spent on IG, but the community we found is great. 
We decided to take the show on the road during the Kickstarter campaign and tour up the west coast to visit some of the biggest coffee cities in the USA. If you live in any of these cities, come say hi and see the Handground prototype in person.
Material Specifications
Black Handground Grinder
The black version of the Handground grinder will be made out of acrylonitrile butadiene styrene, otherwise known as ABS plastic. ABS is considered superior for its hardness, gloss, toughness, and electrical insulation properties. ABS's light weight and ability to be injection molded and extruded make it useful in manufacturing products for everything from musical instruments, to golf clubs heads, to automotive components including bumpers, protective headgear, luggage and protective carrying cases, to coffee grinders :) The list is endless for the applications of ABS plastic.
It is a very strong and durable plastic that will withstand the abuse of even the most careless coffee brewers.
Nickel AND Copper Handground Grinder
The nickel and copper versions of the Handground grinder will be made out of ABS plastic and then electroplated with either nickel or copper metal.
Electroplating enables us to coat plastic with metal to achieve a real metal surface to increase the strength of the plastic substantially without adding a ton of weight to the product. This is a common practice used in home appliances like the sink faucets and handles and in the auto industry. These products look and feel metal because they are coated in actual metal, but if you were to break one in half (which is very hard) you would see that the inside is actually made of a hard plastic. We have currently chosen this method to achieve the nickel and copper finished versions of the grinder.
As discussed in the Risks and challenges, if this process does not live up to our standards and survive our thorough strength and durability tests, we will explore other methods to achieve the results we are looking for, including possibly die-casting the parts out of full metal.
Conical Burrs
The burrs are 38mm conical burr mills made from densely sintered Alumina ceramic which has high strength and hardness, temperature stability, and high wear resistance and corrosion resistance. We are continuing to experiment with material composition, the treatment process for the ceramic, and mechanical design aspects such as the angle and sharpness of the teeth. We will keep everyone updated on our progress with the burrs.
Stainless steel components
The main vertical axle and all screws and washers that will be in contact with the beans will be made from 300 grade stainless steel that you typically see in pans and other cookery tools.
Stainless steel is non-porous, it resists bacteria and germs more effectively than wood or plastic surfaces. It also is one of the most hygienic surfaces available, so any foods that come into contact with the surface or material do not attract dirt or germs. Stainless steel also does not react with coffee or other drink/food products.
Grind Levels

The finest micron level for the grinder is currently set at 100 microns, increasing at 125 micron intervals. We are testing this range and even considering reducing the micron intervals for the first few steps at the finer range so that you can really hone in on your favorite espresso fine grind.

Design: Joaquin Herlein
Video Production, Editing & Sound: Alexis Morrell
Sourcing: Don Craig & BriteHub
Prototyping: Shapeways & Quickparts
Video Contributions: Slayer Espresso & Cold Bruer
Brewing Device Icons: Eric Ellis
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While manufacturing a product has become increasingly easier in today's well-connected world, there are always unforeseen challenges in bringing a brand new product into production. To best prepare for these challenges, we've been consulting with both successful Kickstarter inventors and coffee industry experts.

We've partnered with a sourcing company that has 25 years experience working with factories around the world. They employ professionals both locally in the US and internationally in Asia. Because of their experience working with top-quality factories in Asia, we are confident that we will be able to manufacture a high quality product from this region. We have already completed a round of factory tours and have selected the manufacturers that are most capable of building this product.

The next step of development is the consultation of a professional engineering firm to help conduct stress & longevity analysis. We will be integrating their feedback into our final design for manufacturing and then proceed with the factory that we choose to build the tooling for plastic injection molding. We will be actively involved with the tooling and validation, and plan to travel to the factories in order to inspect and test the initial production pieces before shipment.

As of right now, we see the greatest possible challenges in the areas below:

Coffee Wood Knob: It has been our goal to source the wood for the knob from actual coffee trees from a coffee farm in Central/South America. Coffee wood is rarely, if ever, used to make physical products but our research shows that it has a very high tensile strength. Right now, we have found a large farm in Costa Rica that is going through a major renovation of their farming plot and will have thousands of old coffee shrubs available for our use. The problem that remains is finding a professional wood-shop that is located within a reasonable distance of the farm and capable of mass producing the wood knobs fast enough to then be shipped to our factory for assembly before we ship worldwide, in addition to conducting further tests on strength and durability. This is an ambitious goal that received high interest from Team Handground when we presented the idea months ago. It was clear that everyone loves the idea but that we can do without it, if it raises the cost of production too high.

The wood knob you see now on the prototype is called wengy wood. This is currently our first choice for wood because it is much easier to source than coffee wood. It’s only downside is that it is fairly expensive, although absolutely beautiful. If we are unable to source a large quantity of coffee wood or wengy wood at a reasonable price, then we may have to consider a different type of wood that will achieve a similar look and feel.

Electroplating is a process that uses electric current to reduce dissolved metals so that they form a coherent metal coating on another surface. In other words, science enables us to coat almost any material (including plastic) with metal to achieve a real metal surface that looks and feels like metal because it is metal, to increase the strength of the plastic substantially without adding a ton of weight to the product. This is a common practice used in home appliances like the sink faucets and handles and in the auto industry. These products look and feel metal because they are coated in actual metal, but if you were to break one in half (which is very hard) you would see that the inside is actually made of a hard plastic. We have currently chosen this method to achieve the nickel and copper finished versions of the grinder.

The prototype shown in this Kickstarter has a brushed nickel-like finish. Very thin black lines give the appearance that the product has been brushed. Brushed electroplating achieves this look by physically brushing the plastic parts with a plating solution. Brush electroplating has several advantages over “tank plating”, including portability, ability to plate items that for some reason cannot be tank plated, low or no masking requirements, and comparatively low plating solution volume requirements. Disadvantage compared to tank plating includes greater operator involvement, which can substantially increase the cost of production. We will be able to calculate the cost of production better once we know the initial demand for the grinder through Kickstarter. If the cost for brushed electroplating is too high, or if backers as a part of Team Handground decide they like a different finish better, we can choose from one of many other metal finishes for the grinder, such as a smooth matte finish, to a shiny reflective finish, that don’t require brushed electroplating.

With that said, high quality and strength are our major goals, and even though electroplating is strong on paper, if it does not live up to our standards and survive our thorough strength and durability tests, we will explore other methods to achieve the results we are looking for, including possibly die-casting the parts out of full metal.


Gear material choice: We are currently using brass miter gears to transfer power from the side-mounted handle to the vertical shaft that drives the ceramic burr grinding mechanism. Our initial goal was to use two different sized gears to achieve a higher spin ratio (2:1) so that one turn of the arm corresponded to 2 turns of the burr grinder. This greatly increases the difficulty in turning the handle and we have decided not to use two different sized gears. We are now using brass miter gears that are high in strength. These gears are strong enough but we are continuing to experiment with gears made of other materials, including, but not limited to, stainless steel and delrin, a self-lubricating high strength plastic.

That is all! We will keep you informed with regular updates as our product gets closer to production, and we'll be doing everything possible to stay on schedule and deliver you a high quality and beautiful product. As we’ve done since day one, we will keep everyone involved and be 100% transparent throughout the process. We will turn to you as a backer to help us make decisions as they arise throughout this process, from Kickstarter to your front door.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New Burr Mounting System - Upgrade Kits Are Available!
Copper Grinders Are Finished and Now Shipping!
Production of the Copper Grinders is Underway!
updates.update_content:
We are happy to report that the copper grinders are finally ready for production. After the last backer update we received samples that were electroplated with real copper and then had a protective clear coat applied. 
Upon first inspection they looked really good. The brushed copper look has a great color and reflection in the light. There were a few blemishes on the parts that looked like fingerprints where the workers touched the raw copper before spraying the clear coat. We learned from earlier samples that the natural oils on your hands will react with the raw copper to leave a mark where you touched it. We marked where the existing blemishes were so we could test to see if any new ones appeared.

updates.update_userinfo: Copper Update, Handground Upgrades, We're Hiring!
updates.update_content:
Solution Found For Copper Grinders
We just returned from spending two weeks at the factory in China. Our goal was to find a finishing solution for the copper grinders that is durable and aesthetically pleasing. 
In a survey sent out to the backers of the copper grinders last year the community voted to have the pieces electroplated with real copper and then brushed in the same way that the nickel grinders are brushed.

UGH! The handle popped off on the 4th grind. I am now looking around the house for a hex wrench to do a repair on my brand-new grinder. :) Surprised at how much work it is to grind a small amount of beans! I will say that the unit is very well finished and works well with the handle on.

Caution backers: Mine 'popped' on the second grind. A set screw holding the crank handle on came loose and then doesn't clear the angled plastic top. The resulting contact sent fine shards of plastic everywhere and sheared the set screw. As a precaution, I would add some threadlock to that screw in advance if you want to avoid the same issue. (The allen wrench that comes with the kit does not fit this screw, you have to find your own)

Kickstarter isn't a store, its a crowdfunding micro-investment platform. This entire project was designed around there not being a similar item in its class, so the designers are not going to settle and cut corners, and as an engineer I applaud them for it. I didn't back Hanground because I needed a grinder, I backed Handground because I wanted to fund and receive the best-damn hand grinder possible with zero compromises. I for one continue to support the creators, look forward to more absurdly detailed monthly updates, and the eventual delivery of the product. Grind on!

To those complaining about the delivery date being past due, have you looked at the final wording on your pledge?? The words are " Estimated Delivery", if you look up the word "estimate" it means - A tentative evaluation or rough calculation. So "Estimated Delivery" is not an exact time when something will be done and delivered. I don't know how many of you ever worked on something, be it a project, some thing you do at home, or whatever, but there are many times when you are not able to get it done in the estimated time frame, unless you rush and take short cuts that underscores the quality of the work. So take a chill pill, your life will not end if this wonderful product isn't at your doorstep tomorrow or next week, next month and so on. If you wanted it on time, then you should have waited until it was marketed in the stores or on TV to make your order. I for one is always happy to wait for quality, then to have something rushed with poor craftsmanship.
If you wanted to support someone making the best coffee grinder and some starting a new business then you are in the right place.

@Benjamin Jean - In backing several kickstarter i have learned one thing; the projected delivery date is rarely met. If you get your rewards within 3-4 months of the projected date, it was a wild success. The team so far has been very forthcoming with design updates and seems to be putting forward changes in expected delivery dates frequently. The communication alone is better than a large majority of projects that end up delivering. This is an informal investment in a project with a proposed concrete reward. Project timelines are nearly guaranteed to lapse. I've seen everything from Chinese New Year, dock worker strikes, customs inspections, and tariff issues to compete redesigns throw things off at this point.

Regardless, ideally this grinder will start at Turkish and allow 3 grind settings for espresso. That's where the range control is the most critical. I doubt it makes a great difference whether the coarser grinds are +/- 50 microns but at the espresso level it's critical. So Team Handground please be sure espresso grind settings work well. I thought I remembered you saying you were going to try to expand the espresso range (ie, non-linearity in the adjustment mechanism). The advantages of ceramic burrs is that thry stay sharp twice as long as steel and disipate heat just as well as steel. Steel burrs are good because they are cheaper to make and can survive an errant rock in your grinder. Make sure to inspect your beans before you start grinding and you should have the burrs last for a very long time. I vote to keep the burrs ceramic for these reasons.

campaign.story:
SIRI SRIRACHA SAUCE
We are changing your perception of what sriracha sauce is. Is it a condiment, a hot sauce, a dipping sauce, or a cooking sauce? The truth is, sriracha sauce is all of the above and MORE!
For the sriracha purists, our traditional sriracha sauce is exactly what you  expect it to be, a little spicy and a little sweet with a hint of garlic. For those that are bolder, we have also developed a few very distinct sriracha sauces. See the chart below for a quick description of our sriracha.
LAST YEAR I launched my first sriracha Kickstarter <---(click here to see it) to raise enough money to help me get my family sriracha recipe from my kitchen table to local farmer's markets. I was so excited to have raised 896% more funds than I had originally hoped for. I was able to use the extra money to do all of the things promised in that Kickstarter, including refining my recipes and investing in the equipment I needed to get into farmer's markets. Since then we have continued to grow and have done many great things, including redesign our labels, rent a commercial kitchen for the production and storage of our sriracha, and even started development of a new sriracha sauce.
TODAY we need your help to bring our newest sriracha sauce to the world. Our Ghost Pepper Sriracha is the hottest and most flavorful yet. We use smoked bhut jolokia peppers (along with a lot of love) in our new recipe. Like all of our sriracha sauces, we age our peppers until they are ready to become sriracha sauce.
 Rewards are all listed on the right side of this page.Please take your time to browse them and select the one that fits you best. In addition to our delicious sriracha sauces, we have included some swag for you to choose from as well. Of course we have stretch goals that we want to achieve as well, and the rewards for those can be found further down.
Our Goals and Stretch Goals are ambitious, but we are confident that with your help, we will be able to achieve them. Our original goal and our stretch goals are all outlined below for you. Of course, every time we reach a stretch goal a unique reward will be sent FREE to every backer. Please help us bring the best sriracha sauces to the world.
https://twitter.com/CarmichaelFoods
https://www.facebook.com/carmichaelfoods
http://www.carmichaelfoods.com
 THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING US!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The largest risk is that local produce takes longer than expected to buy in bulk. If this were to happen, the receiving date could be pushed out from December to January or February for some orders.

A minor risk would be that our Kickstarter does better than we thought, and the volume of orders adds to our production and shipping time. But we are experienced and know how to prepare for such a wonderful risk.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
All $20, $30, $40, $50, and $100 rewards have been shipped, with the exception of a few international orders.
The only reward left to ship is the $10 rewards, we are working hard on getting them all shipped by Friday.
Lastly, once that is done, we will start sending out replacement bottles to the handful of backers who received damaged/broken bottles.

Hi Guys and Gals.

Thanks for all the inquiries. We are getting ready to take a large batch of $20 rewards to the post office right now (Monday morning), about 70 packages. We have one last $20 reward batch to pack/ship (expected by Tuesday or Wednesday) before we start on the $10 rewards tier.

Thanks for hanging in there a bit longer than expected, but we hope you think it is worth it once you get your sauces.
Siri

Hi All,
I am getting a lot of questions about where to find the ghost pepper sriracha, the sriracha powder, and the sriracha chili paste.
All will be available via our website by the end of this month.
Thanks,

Hi All.

I am glad to be getting more feedback that orders are "NOT BROKEN". Since the half a dozen complaints we got earlier in the shipping process, we decided to rethink the way we are packing and shipping. It looks like it may have solved the problem, or at least drastically reduced it. Since we started packing differently, we have shipped an additional 100 orders or so, and only one recent complaint of a broken bottle.

Hi Kickstarter Backers,
I wanted to give you all a quick update on where things are at with shipping.
So far we have sent out about 400 orders, and have about another 210 to ship out. We are working every day to get as many out as we can. Thank you for your support and patience, I know that we had wanted to have everything thing shipped to you by the end of March, and as it is now, we probably won't have everything shipped until the end of April. So again, thank you for your understanding.

Great news everyone. 
We finished bottling this morning, and will start labeling, packing and shipping tomorrow.
Our plan is to start shipping the rewards in order of backing. So those that backed us first will be the first orders shipped out.
We hope to pack and ship about 100 orders per day, and have all orders shipped within the next 6 - 7 days.

Hi Kickstarter Backers,
The peppers are almost done fermenting. We are checking them several times a day. We expect them to be ready tomorrow or the next day.
Once they are ready, we will start bottling and shipping.
Our best guess is that we will start shipping the first batches out by this coming weekend. And be completely finished shipping all rewards to all backers no later than the end of this month, but likely sooner if no problems arise.

Hi Kickstarters,
Great news, all of our red peppers came in last week, and they have been fermenting since last Wednesday. Another 7-10 days of fermenting and then we will start manufacturing.
If all goes well, we are looking at the first orders to start shipping by the middle or March (or sooner).

Hello Kickstarter Backers,
It has been a couple of weeks and i wanted to let you all know where things are at.
Two small steps forward, we have received our labels and over 1,200 bottles.
However, we have had two minor set backs as well.

Hi All,
I just wanted to post a quick update, and let everyone know where things are at.
Kickstarter released all funds into our account last Thursday and we immediately went to work. We have ordered over 600 pounds of peppers and other fresh ingredients, over 1,200 bottles.

campaign.story:
Thanks everybody for embracing our message! ZenEgg project will continue its story on our webpage :)
For all of you who still haven't decided on your holiday gifts, we have designed a special ZenEgg gift-card that you can give to your loved ones or friends in their stockings or under a christmas tree. This year Santa is coming in March :) You can download it H E R E. Peaceful and relaxing holidays to you all!
REMINDER: Fitting into your home and office, ZenEgg is designed to sit comfortably on your desk, table or shelf. It reminds you to pause what you are doing and take a few minutes to reflect. 

STRESS RELIEVER: Stress balls were created to relax the tensions in your hands and mind. ZenEgg works in much the same way, except it has been created out of warm, touchy materials.

MASSAGE OBJECT: Made from solid wood, the rounded shape of the egg allows you to apply pressure directly and easily to relieve body tension.

TOY: Nudge it, spin it, roll it.. No matter how you interact with it, the experience is always fun. Its playful character makes the ZenEgg a perfect gift no matter what age.
ERGONOMICS: My goal was to find the ideal shape to fit in my palm. The familiar and simplistic shape of an egg was the perfect answer. ZenEgg is designed to feel comfortable in your hands. With a weighted base, it always restores its balance.

NATURAL FEEL: ZenEgg is made out of carefully selected Walnut, Pear and Maple woods. Working with these materials gives each ZenEgg a unique pattern and an inherent natural aroma. The warmth of the solid wood, gives the egg the natural feel that your body responds to.

LOCALLY PRODUCED: ZenEggs are hand-crafted, following an age-old tradition of local woodcraft. Even though the shape itself is quite simple, the process behind it takes true craftsmanship to make it. Every ZenEgg is treated with organic oils to increase its durability. They are made with a high level of precision, tested and checked to ensure top level quality.
ZenEgg was created with an emphasis on tangible sensations. We are tactile creatures; it’s common for us to have something in our hands. I started to realise that every object that we hold is associated with some activity that we automatically start to do. It’s for this reason that I wanted to develop an object for taking time out.
Hidden from view, there is a meaning imbued in every egg. The Ouroboros, an icon that symbolises self-reflexivity, is burnt in on the inner surface of every wooden fitting.
Note: Wood is live material so textures, lines and colours may differ from one ZenEgg to another. Also, in time colour of the wood will darken. All of our ZenEggs are treated with natural oils to ensure the most natural feel and aroma. The Olive ZenEgg is oiled with a mixture of olive oil an lavender.
DARK WALNUT
Average Dried Weight: 38 lbs/ft3 (610 kg/m3) (of walnut wood)
Appearance: Heartwood can range from a lighter pale brown to a dark chocolate brown with darker brown streaks. Colour can sometimes have a grey, purple, or reddish cast.
Grain/Texture: Grain is usually straight, but can be irregular. Has a medium texture and moderate natural luster.
MAGNIFICiENT PEAR
Average Dried Weight: 43 lbs/ft3 (690 kg/m3) (of pear wood)
Appearance: Heartwood is light reddish brown. Sapwood is slightly paler but is not usually distinct from heartwood.
Grain/Texture: Grain is usually straight, with a very fine uniform texture.
LIGHT MAPLE
Average Dried Weight: 44 lbs/ft3 (705 kg/m3) (of maple wood)
Appearance: Colour ranges from nearly white, to an off-white cream colour.
Grain/Texture: Grain is generally straight, but may be wavy. Has a fine, even texture.
SOOTHING OLIVE
Average dried Weight: 62 lbs/ft3 (990 kg/m3) (of olive wood)
Appearance: Heartwood is a cream or yellowish brown, with darker brown or black contrasting streaks. Color tends to deepen with age. Olive is sometimes figured with curly or wavy grain, burl, or wild grain.
Grain/Texture: Grain may be straight, interlocked, or wild. Fine uniform texture with moderate natural luster.
COLORFUL PLUM
Average Dried Weight:50 lbs/ft3 (795 kg/m3) (of plum wood)
Color/Appearance: Plum heartwood can exhibit a cornucopia of colors, typically a yellowish brown, with streaks of pink, orange, red, purple, olive, or grey mixed in. Because of the small size of plum trees, swirled or irregular grain, as well as knots and other defects are common.
Grain/Texture: Has a fine texture with close grain and a slight natural luster.
DEEP WENGE
Average Dried Weight:54 lbs/ft3 (870 kg/m3) (of wenge wood)
Color/Appearance: Heartwood is a very dark brown with black streaks. Upon application of a wood finish (particularly an oil-finish) the wood can become nearly black.
Grain/Texture: Grain is straight, with a very coarse texture. Low natural luster and large pores in no specific arrangement. Brown mineral deposits are occasionally present, growth rings are distinct.
All the ZenEggs are available as a single reward or as an add-on. A lot of you were asking about a bundle of two the ZenEggs, so we made it possible by adding the Add-on feature. You can also order a bundle of three.
How does it work? Add-ons can only be added to an existing reward (ZenEgg, Duo or Nest). To add an additional ZenEgg, select your chosen reward and write in the price sum of the previous selected ZenEgg plus the new one (you do this manually). Example: Walnut ZenEgg (18$) + Wenge ZenEgg add-on (30$) = total (48$). The add-on feature is available for all ZenEggs in our rewards system (Walnut, Maple or Pear add-on = 16$, Olive = 25$, Plum = 22$). For any additional questions just write us a message.
Although I designed the product and sourced the producers, the tooling and material costs are simply too much for me to afford on my own. The campaign goal is set at just enough to cover the costs of tools, labour, shipping and materials. After this costs are covered, I’ll be able to produce more ZenEggs in a more sustainable way.
Throughout this design process I’ve been fortunate enough to get help from some lovely people. They saw the message I was trying to make and they supported me. 
Jan Kikelj / Project management & Communication strategy
Miha Artnak / Visual identity
Lucijan Kranjc, Alen Bubanja / Photography
Ethan Grant / Customer relationship
Nejc Matjaž / Production advisory
Miha Možina, Andraž Jerič, Juš Premrov / Video & Sound
Blaž Beuermann, Srdjan Prodanović/ Web development
Eva Perčič, Luka Piškorič, Peter Ružič, Janez Uplaznik / Business advisory 
Simon Penšek / Studio sound recording
Anja Humljan, Iris Čeh, Ana Osredkar, Naja Kikelj / Help with content
Creative Centre Poligon / Creative environment
Maker Lab / Photo studio
Poti-Poti / 3D printing
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With the design process finished and our producers chosen, we’re thankfully in a pretty safe position. It’s not a complicated project and all the shipping and people helping out really make this something I’m not worried about. The production of ZenEgg is in good hands, and I hope they’ll soon be in yours!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: All New Zen Egg Alter Eggo
updates.update_content:
Hi there
I would like to invite you to watch the video with a funny story about the brand new Zen Egg.
You have backed the first Zen Egg project 5 years ago. Although it was my first project, you believed in me and that gave me strength to step on the path of entrepreneurship. Thank you.

Hello ZenEggers! 
Curious about what ZenEgg has been up to in the past few weeks?
Firstly, we were testing new types of wood and quite a few of them passed the detailed inspection (process and material wise). Of course there also had to be a winner..we are presenting the Mahogany ZenEgg!

Hello ZenEgg family! 
One year has passed since we first met, wishing we would create more time for ourselves and find our inner peace. Today I want to share my personal view of the past 12 months. 
I have started this project to emphasise the importance of calmness and tranquility but paradoxically the scope of the project led to my total exhaustion. So I decided to move to a calm and peaceful place, where I have regained my strengths both mentally and physically. With our first anniversary just around the corner, I started to think about the first steps of the ZenEgg project. It was quite unusual. At the begging I did not have any special plans or wishes, I just wanted to share what life had thought me so far. I remember having a feeling that ZenEgg already existed and just picked me and me team to manifest itself :)

Dear backers,
  we finished an important chapter on our Kickstarter journey. On this path we faced many unexpected obstacles. It took us a bit more time than we anticipated but we managed to overcome all of the problems and have brought to you a high quality product.
Here is a short video:

Dear backers!
  We are happy to announce that we have just dispatched all of the ZenEggs. They should be at your home in couple of weeks at the latest. 

We are at the final stage of our Kickstarter journey; just some of your individual questions are yet to be resolved. Right now we are also preparing an update and a short video about the path we overcame in the last six months.

In the last couple of months we had problems with the Olive ZenEgg production, as you already know. We tried every possibility to manage and produce the rest 500 Olive eggs, but it was impossible to find quality and strong wood which wouldn't crack during the production.
In the moment of desperation and struggle, there came the saviour of the ZenEgg family that brought back optimism - Zebrano! Zebrano wood brings equal quality and aesthetic values as Olive wood and is at this point more suitable solution. Why? We cannot get the right thickness of the olive wood piles, if we do, the piles crack in 90% of cases which results in huge wood waste and we can only send you zen barbecue briquettes :)

Dear ZenEggers!
I am happy to announce that plum ZenEgg is finally in production and ready to be shipped. At this point we would like to thank you for your patience and all the kind words you send us. New eggs are dispatched every day. 
Each egg goes through 10 day quality control before shipping. I want to be sure to deliver high quality product.

updates.update_userinfo: Plum egg successfully produced, olive egg on its way!
updates.update_content:
Dear ZenBackers!
What ZenEgg has taught as so far is that production of quality wooden eggs can only be achieved in a zen way - with a lot of awareness, attention and precision. Production is taking a bit more time that we anticipated but the good news is that we have already shipped more than third of the packages. Eggs are constantly shipping out and some of you can already enjoy the ZenEgg experience, we hope that the eggs help you bring calmness into your everyday.

Hi ZenEggers!
Thanks for your patience. ZenEgg has started shipping packages and some of you have them home already. On the downside... there is more work and difficulties than we thought. So the production is taking slowly but surely. You might enjoy the video #hatchedegg, while waiting for your package.
Speak soon!
Gašper

campaign.story:
Jogger Denim = stretch denim jogger pants made in Canada. We've designed and built these pants from the ground up, based on 3 priorities:
   ● JEANS, MEET SWEATS. Yes, you can have it all. Imagine the flexibility and comfort of sweatpants and the look and reliability of denim. That's us. Our Jogger Denim stretches, breathes, and is made in Canada under the highest standards.
● DAILY COMFORT.
Most jeans make you struggle, pull, and twist to put them on. And then they squeeze and cut your midsection all day! No, thanks. Jogger Denim adjusts to your shape with a high-grade elastic waistband and drawstring-- a revolutionary improvement for jeans. It's like you aren't wearing pants. 
● UNPARALLELED STYLE.
Jogger Denim has a sleek silhouette that suits all occasions. It's sharp and bold for business, and fun and flexible for play. Plus its clean, cuffed finish makes other pants look baggy, and a little outdated.
 ● NO MORE RESTRICTIONS
Often times denim will be very restrictive especially around the groin area. Jogger Denim is modeled after sweatpants and has a relaxed fit around the groin much like sweatpants.

● CYCLING
Since Jogger denim is cuffed, it naturally reduces the amount of times you'll get your pantleg caught in the chain!
 In today's world, jeans are a daily necessity. But every morning, we wake up, and a part of us doesn't want to settle for the same restrictive, confining pants that people have worn for decades. 
What about sweatpants, you ask? Well, sweats are comfy but send the wrong message in public. What about jeans? They look better, but their lack of flexibility and fit don't compliment today's active lifestyle. 

In today's world, we need the comfort and personalized fit of sweatpants. 

In today's world, we also need the look and reliability of jeans. 

It's time for something new. Together, right here and now, let's create Jogger Denim. 
It is our vision that, as the first to own Jogger Denim, you get...

● More comfortable days and nights. No need to struggle into these pants. No painful buttons or zippers. Jogger Denim adjust immediately with a high-grade elastic waistband and hardy drawstring capped with our signature rose-gold hardware.
● Access to your full potential. Most denim restricts your ability to move, stopping you from living life at 100%. Most denim simply doesn't stretch. Ours does. Running, biking, commuting, exercising, playing sports, getting to important places, dancing or just enjoying life-- Jogger Denim will take you there.
● Unparalleled looks. Much like you, Jogger Denim is sharp and professional when it needs to be. But it has a kind, flexible side as well. You can wear these pants from the boardroom to a party, and get compliments in both places.
Jogger Denim features...

● Technologically advanced denim. Denim has come a long way in the past few years, allowing Jogger Denim to stretch, provide comfort, and take a hit-- all while retaining its shape.
 ● Quality craftsmanship. Jogger Denim is made in Canada, and your pair will be individually appraised for over 50 points of quality. We use 10 stitches per inch to ensure the seams will weather any storm.
● A fit that's all your own. Yes, the denim stretches. But the pants also adjust to your shape with a high-grade elastic waistband (which beats zippers and belts 100x over, we promise), and a drawstring. 
● Signature details that elevate your style. The denim itself is minimal, so that you can wear Jogger Denim from the boardroom to the party. However, each pair comes with carefully-selected rivets and drawstrings to accent your look.
 ● Far below-retail pricing. Kickstarter is family to us. Because you're helping us create Jogger Denim with your ideas, enthusiasm, and ledges (and because we're cutting out the retail middleman by selling
online) Jogger Denim comes to you far below retail pricing! 
● Our guarantee. If you try them on, and are not totally satisfied with the fit and function, send them back (we'll pay the return) and we'll issue a refund for store credit. 
CHOOSING YOUR SIZE
Jogger denim is versatile because it has an adjustable waistband that can change sizes. This is great for the daily things you're exposed to in life. It can be made tighter if you're exercising or being active and looser if you're just relaxing around the house or treating yourself to a nice meal. You can forget about sorting through many different pairs of pants for your daily needs. And even better, say goodbye to restrictive buttons.

 The fit is inspired by sweatpants. Comfortable, minimal and fitted but not too tight. We've also eliminated the bagginess and mess of flared pantcuffs. Simply put, Jogger Denim will feel and fit fantastic on you. The inseam length is reduced because unlike regular jeans, it won't have the extra 2-3 inches of bagginess of the jeans hitting the floor. 

Jogger denim is unisex and comes in :

• Men's Jeans: offered in Jogger Denim Classic fit. Unlike rigid jeans, Jogger denim’s adjustable drawstring can expand and tighten to fit a range of sizes like a sweatpant. Waist sizes offered are 28-30 with inseam length of 28”, 31-33 with inseam length of 30”, 34-36 with inseam length of 32”. ( The inseam length is shorter than regular jeans because the cuff stops above the shoe)

• Women's Jeans: offered in Jogger Denim Classic fit. Unlike rigid jeans, Jogger denim’s adjustable drawstring can expand and tighten to fit a range of sizes like a sweatpant. Waist sizes offered are 24-26 with inseam length of 24”, 27-29 with inseam length of 26”, 30-32 with inseam length of 28”. ( The inseam length is shorter than regular jeans because the cuff stops above the shoe)
As we write this, only a few pairs of Jogger Denim exist. But so far, it's the only pant to provide the comfort of sweats with the reliability of jeans.

To get a pair for yourself, friends, or family, make a pledge and receive a pair of Jogger Denim pants at a discounted price. We have been working for the last two years with a top-class Canadian pattern drafter and manufacturer, and now all we need is you to bring this to life. We would also love to make it even better and innovate further with your help!

The designing, testing and production are all in place now. We are ready to bring Jogger Denim to the mainstream market and need your help. To get a pair for yourself, friends, or family, make a pledge and receive a pair of Jogger Denim pants at a discounted price for a limited time. 
If you try them on, and are not totally satisfied with the fit and function, send them back (we'll pay the return) and we'll issue a refund for store credit. 

The Jogger Denim can be returned for free if it's...
●  Unworn and in its original packaging
●  Returned within 14 days of receipt
When we receive them, you'll receive full store credit for use on our online store. 
If you want a pair of jeans that lets your live life at 100%, please share this campaign page. Who knows, you might help someone discover the perfect pair of jeans for themselves. 
Here's how to connect: You can also find some exciting numbers about Jogger Denim on Kicktraq. We're an official Day-1 Project.
There's a typo. It's actually January 2015! Not 2014!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In our experience, most backers are concerned about late fulfillment. We've take a few steps at this stage of development to make sure that the rewards are delivered promptly. 

● We have secured our supply chain from raw materials all the way through to manufacturing and fulfillment. 
● The Canadian manufacturer that we've selected has worked with us for two years, and has a 10-year track record impeccable, highly functional clothing for groups like the police force.
● We have a team of friendly, passionate support to offer help with fit, sizing, pricing, media, and anything else you'd like to know. 

Thanks for checking out the Jogger Denim campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Jogger Denim: final deliveries + your thoughts
updates.update_content:
It's been a few months since you brought Canadian Jogger Denim to life! Thank you! In the coming weeks, the product that YOU helped create will actually be on store shelves and worn by many.  
In that spirit, here are a few closing items: 

(1) Your Order. For those who have yet to receive their pair (and there are a few), we'll be doing another round of shipping this week. If you have any concerns about your reward, I'm here to help! 
 
(2) Most backers have had their pair since the holidays-- what do you think? We're always looking for ways to improve. 

Wayne

Hi! The campaign is over, with backers worldwide set to receive Jogger Denim! We're excited. Here's what to do next: 

1. I've just sent a SURVEY to your email. Please specify your sizing right away, especially those with Christmas delivery! Even if I've already asked you, please enter it to confirm and make it official. 

2. Once we have your sizes, PRODUCTION begins right away in beautiful Toronto, Canada! We'll keep you updated as manufacturing proceeds.

will happen directly after production, with those in Christmas tiers being the first to ship out.

Questions? Feel free to send me a message here on Kickstarter, or simply comment on this update. Talk soon, and thank you for creating Jogger Denim with us.
